title: Care Manager (Health Homes Program)
description:
Acacia Network, the leading Latino integrated care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing and community building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we've been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland and Puerto Rico.

The **Care Manager (Health Homes)** provides patients advocacy, outreach, education, and care management services. Skills and competencies required for the position include communication, cultural competence, training professional experiences, and education. The activities are tailored to meet the unique needs of the communities. This position includes no managerial or supervisory responsibilities.

**The salary is $42,000/Year.**

KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

* Provide direct coaching, education, and advocacy in linking, engaging and retaining clients in services identified in the Plan of Care.
* Escort clients to appointments and provide and gather critical information, both in the field and in the office, with the goal of health and wellness promotion and a reduction in preventable negative health or social events.
* Elicit the support of all providers involved in a client's care and ensure maximized communication among all parties via face to face contacts, phone calls, emails, case conferences, etc.
* Conduct vigorous outreach in identifying and locating potential clients either referred through the community or by the lead Health Home.
* Provide intensive care management services to clients living with chronic illnesses and their families/support systems and advocate aggressively for clients to obtain the full range of needed services and ensures coordination of these services.
* Ensures the timely completion of internal and external required assessments (Comprehensive Assessments, HARP Eligibility Assessment, Eligibility and Appropriateness Assessment, etc.).
* Ensures the timely completion of the initial Plan of Care and plan reviews based on Lead Health Home policy.
* Ensures the Plan of Care for each enrolled member includes quality SMART goals, interventions and targets.
* Actively participate in supervision with care management supervisor as scheduled and be prepared to discuss topics around caseload, engagement, productivity, work related concerns, barriers, trainings, etc.
* Complete all documentation timely ie; progress notes, comprehensive assessments, POC, consents, etc., in accordance with the BAHN, Health Homes and departmental policies.
* Complete and document productivity of a minimum of five unique and billable services per day.
* Responsible for the overall chart compliance of assigned caseload members.
* Demonstrate the ability to clearly articulate, verbally and in writing, the aims and goals of the Health Home program and the process to potential clients and community members and Acacia Network staff.
* Responsible for coordinating, attending, documenting all provider case conferences.
* Participate in quality improvement activities, projects and reviews.
* Complete periodic requests for narrative or quantitative data reports for program review.
* Identify new sources of potential clients and conduct outreach presentations as requested.
* Meet regularly with supervisor and attend staff meetings. Be prepared to discuss care management and operational issues impacting performance and program operations.
* Complete and submit daily activity log in accordance with departmental policies.
* Maintain and update caseload tracking tool.
* Escort clients to entitlement offices to gain, maintain or regain eligibility; Verify client eligibility through ePaces, as requested.
* Conduct outreach in accordance with Health Home policy via phone, letter, and field work to client/collateral/provider/ support system. to engage clients or strengthen connectivity.
* Conduct home visits on a monthly basis to members on caseload as needed to provide comprehensive care management services.
* Provide Diligent and Continued Search efforts in order to regain and maintain member engagement.
* Provide member referrals to Health Navigator and Outreach team via member referral to HHSA and HHSC.
* Attend Supervision with care management supervisor as scheduled and be prepared to discuss topics around caseload, engagement, work related concerns, barriers, trainings, etc.
* Assess and respond per agency guidelines to client complaints or grievances.
* Help maintain health and wellness and prevent secondary disease complications.
* Ensure community-follow up to engage the client in care; promotes compliance with medical appointments and encourages client self-sufficiency and empowerment.
* Coordinate schedule and appointments with Health Navigator to ensure client attendance at appointments or engage in outreach efforts.
* Organize fieldwork to maximize delivery of service to clients.
* Utilize company issued cell phone to stay in contact with members/ providers/ Health Home team on a 24 hour basis.
* Coordinate, communicate and support members within serviced boroughs.

REQUIREMENTS:

* **Bachelor's Degree required.**
* Bachelor's Degree in one of the following fields is required: social work, psychology, nursing, rehabilitation, education, occupational therapy, physical therapy, recreation or recreation therapy, counseling, community mental health, child and family studies, sociology, speech and hearing or other human services fields preferred.
* Two (2) years' experiences in successful community outreach/recruitment or volunteer coordination preferred.
* Must obtain Mandated reporter (2 hours) prior to hire date.
* Website info: https://nysmandatedreporter.org/TrainingCourses.aspx
* Excellent public speaking and presentation skills.
* Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing.
* Ability to connect with others and forge strong relationships.
* Highly organized, motivated self-starter. Excellent time management skills.
* Ability to organize and maintain detailed records; complete necessary paperwork and meet deadlines.
* General knowledge of organization, community and/or social service resources and programs.
* Bilingual - Spanish speaking a plus.

**\\*Acacia network is an Equal Opportunity Employer\\***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Case management or outreach: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: Underwriter, Healthcare
description:
With a company culture rooted in collaboration, expertise and innovation, we aim to promote progress and inspire our clients, employees, investors and communities to achieve their greatest potential. Our work is the catalyst that helps others achieve their goals. In short, We Enable Possibility℠.
Job Summary
At Arch, our goal is to provide talented people a foundation where their skills are best used. Our diversified platform means there are a variety of opportunities to deploy your skill sets.
We are seeking a creative and motivated individual to join our Healthcare Professional Liability Underwriting team. Our suite of Healthcare products, engaged management team and strong capital base have enabled us to establish a prominent presence in the growing Medical Malpractice market. Our Healthcare team embraces the collaboration necessary to innovate in today’s evolving marketplace; encourages participation and diversity of thought; and relies on talented, innovative individuals to set Arch apart from our competitors.
If you have the ability to identify and develop profitable underwriting opportunities, cultivate new and existing distribution channels, and work well with others, we want you on our team. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented with strong analytical skills and excellent communication and presentation abilities. This person should be service oriented with a focus on responsiveness and meeting or exceeding broker’s needs and timelines. We are looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can efficiently prioritize and manage multiple tasks and responsibilities. This is an excellent opportunity for a self-motivated individual with a desire to learn and grown in a collaborative team environment.
Job Responsibilities* Underwrites and maintains Healthcare Medical Malpractice new business and renewal accounts. Develops underwriting solutions, determines insurability, calculates appropriate premium, and thoroughly documents files.
* Prepare quotations and binds business with a particular emphasis on assessing risk and reaching premium goals as determined by the division head. Sustains the profitability of our business and meets growth objectives by monitoring submissions received, quote and bind ratios, and renewal retentions.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships and credibility with all distribution channels, drive opportunities that meet our underwriting appetite, and effectively communicate underwriting decisions.
* Continually develop and share your industry knowledge, understand competitor products and offerings, and the excess and surplus lines market.
* Contribute recommendations and support to initiatives focused on improving processes, procedures and practices.
* Perform analyses using a range of productivity and analytical tools to analyze historical performance and identify opportunities for improvement.


Desired Skills* Excellent oral and written communication skills with both internal and external constituents.
* Knowledge of Healthcare line of business and Medical Malpractice liability insurance principles.
* Understanding of liability insurance policy wording, terms and conditions.
* Proven history of effectively assessing risk and making sound underwriting decisions
* Established broker relationships including experience working with both wholesalers and retailers.
* Superior skills in relationship building, active listening, needs analysis, and negotiation.
* Possess strong organizational, multi-tasking and time management skills
* Strategic thinking and decision-making skills
* Ability to work well in team-based environment
* Ability to adapt in a rapidly changing environment
* Strong math or financial skills


Required Education/Experience* The preferred candidate will possess a 4-year BA/BS degree, ideally with a major/concentration in Business, Economics or Management
* The preferred candidate will have 1+ years of underwriting experience with a focus on medical malpractice and umbrella liability coverages for various types of healthcare facilities (long term care, hospitals, surgery centers, clinics, labs, home health care, etc.)
* CPCU, RPLU or other insurance course work are a plus, but not required


For individuals assigned or hired to work in California, Colorado, Hawaii, Jersey City, NJ; New York State; and/or Washington State, the base salary range is listed below. This range is as of the time of posting. Position is incentive eligible.
$80,000 - $100,000/year* Total individual compensation (base salary, short & long-term incentives) offered will take into account a number of factors including but not limited to geographic location, scope & responsibilities of the role, qualifications, talent availability & specialization as well as business needs. The above range may be modified in the future
* Click here to learn more on available benefits


Do you like solving complex business problems, working with talented colleagues and have an innovative mindset? Arch may be a great fit for you. If this job isn’t the right fit but you’re interested in working for Arch, create a job alert! Simply create an account and opt in to receive emails when we have job openings that meet your criteria. Join our talent community to share your preferences directly with Arch’s Talent Acquisition team.

title: Production Manager
description:

* **Operations Management:** Oversee operations of overseas manufacturing facilities, ensuring that production schedules are met while maintaining high standards of quality and safety.

title: Medical Assistant (Hybrid)
description:
Started in 2016, FreedomCare is a Healthcare company that is innovating and revolutionizing the way home care is delivered. We bring dignity and support to patients needing care in their homes and to the caregivers who care for them. We're the largest consumer-directed home care agency in NY State, and are continually expanding our areas of focus including operations in other states and tech-based innovations.



We pride ourselves on our values which drive the level of care that we deliver to our patients:


* Here For You (An attitude of service, empathy, and availability)
* Own It (Drive and ownership)
* Do the Right Thing (High integrity)
* Be Positive (Great attitude and a can-do positive approach to challenges)


Join our team and make a positive impact on the lives of others! We are looking for a Medical Assistantfor our Physician Practice team.


*This is a hybrid role that requires a regularly scheduled commute/travel to our main office in Lake Success, NY and/or the FreedomCare hub closest to you.*


**Department & Position Overview:**



This is a primarily remote role but may be hybrid depending on teammates state of residence.  

  

The Medical Assistant supports Freedomcare Med in providing quality patient care through various clinical tasks and occasional administrative duties. This role is integral to ensuring smooth patient flow and optimal clinic operations, whether during in-person visits or through virtual medical care. The Medical Assistant collaborates closely with clinical providers, patients, and administrative staff to enhance the patient's experience and improve care delivery.


**Every ay You Will:**


* Welcome and assist patients during in-person and virtual visits, ensuring a comfortable and efficient experience
* Prepare patients for examination, take vital signs, and accurately document patient information in the electronic health record (EHR) system
* Collect and document patient histories and conduct medication reconciliation at the time of, or prior to, visits
* Assist in managing chronic disease patients, ensuring they follow their care plans and receive timely follow-ups
* Provide technical support to patients and providers during virtual visits, resolving any issues that arise
* Educate patients about procedures, medications, and health maintenance
* Follow clinician orders for lab work referrals, ensure proper lab results are documented in the EMR, and follow up with patients as directed
* Follow up with patients after sick visits or treatment to check on their progress and ensure they are adhering to their care plans
* Ensure all patient interactions and clinical procedures are accurately documented


**Ideal Candidate Will Possess:**


* 3+ year as a Medical Assistant within a physician practice
* Proficient in electronic health record systems
* Proficient in Microsoft Suite
* Excellent written, and verbal communication skills
* Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time effectively
* Strong communication skills; empathetic and puts the patient's needs first
* Strong problem-solving and critical thinking; able to troubleshoot and investigate when in need of the right solution


**Nice-to-Have**


* Telehealth experience
* Bilingual fluency in English and Spanish


**Why work at FreedomCare?**



We are here for you and committed to providing a best-in-class employee experience. We offer competitive compensation, medical benefits, retirement plans, wellness programs, fun company events and ongoing learning opportunities to grow your career.



This is a place where your voice matters, where we build great relationships, and your work has meaning and a tangible positive impact on others!


*At FreedomCare, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.*

title: Manager of Communications
description:
#### **Follow your passion**



Are you looking to make a BIG impact? At Zeta, we pursue an unprecedented combination of high academic achievement and social-emotional development for our students. We insist that every student receives a world-class education while fostering a love for learning. We are passionate about changing the landscape of public education in New York City and beyond, and we are uncompromising in our mission.



Currently, we operate multiple elementary and middle schools in the Bronx and Upper Manhattan. We plan to grow and open 1-2 schools each year because children in every community deserve excellent, equitable education. Join our growing team today, and be a change agent for children.



Our Network office is located at 401 W. 218th St., New York, NY 10034. Our Network team follows a hybrid work schedule with at least two days (Tuesdays and Thursdays) in office, depending on what each role's scope of work permits. This role will likely require additional in-person time to cover events and meet with team members across Zeta sites.


#### **Deliver powerful results**



To achieve our vision, we are searching for a **Manager of Communications** with a Bachelor's Degree and **2+ years of experience in communications, marketing, public relations, and/or a related field**, who is fueled by a passion for storytelling and equitable education.



The ideal candidate will be an exceptional verbal and written communicator, strategist, and project manager who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. This role reports to the Director of Strategic Impact and works closely with Zeta's CEO.


**Responsibilities:**


* Take full ownership to ensure Zeta has a strong, consistent, and powerful brand across all external communications and to amplify Zeta's voice across earned and owned media
* Devise and execute the content and PR strategy to raise Zeta's profile across all channels
* Manage Zeta's PR firm to excellent outcomes, ensuring frequent and positive local/city coverage of Zeta events along with feature pieces in national outlets; expand Zeta's reach through new outlets and channels (e.g., podcasts)
* Manage the CEO's communications calendar, including ghost-writing, editing, and project managing emails, blogs, and presentations
* Drive special communications projects with significant cross-functional collaboration (e.g., family communications projects with school teams and the family outreach team)
* Manage Zeta's website and partner with the Director of Marketing to ensure a world-class website experience at all times
* Leverage an entrepreneurial mindset and data-driven approach to continuously test, learn, and iterate Zeta's communications to achieve improved results over time
* Wear multiple hats as a part of a lean startup-up team, supporting the work of others on the team and taking on new projects and tasks as needed

#### **Join our purpose-driven community**



Zeta teammates are lifelong learners who live with child-like joy and a deep sense of purpose. We disrupt the status quo and tackle problems together. Our team stands united by our commitment to a limitless future for every child. Our Zeta team is comprised of top talent with incredible schooling and private sector experience. At Zeta:


* We are passionate about our mission of providing world-class education to all students
* We bring a mindset of growth, flexibility, and openness to feedback
* We are hungry and determined to not only meet our goals, but surpass them
* We are humble, willing to put the team's needs ahead of our own, and committed to contributing to a collaborative work environment
* We have a high bar for excellence and sweat over the details
* We are caring and put team over individual at all times


**We are hiring for an immediate opening.** The salary range for this position is between $65,000 and $85,000. New hires can expect to be brought into the organization at a salary at or near the start of the range, depending on relevant experience and internal equity. Compensation is based on our salary scales. This position is eligible to receive an annual discretionary, merit-based performance bonus.


**How does Zeta invest in you?**


**We offer great benefits:**


* Comprehensive and affordable medical, dental, and vision plans
* Flexible spending accounts for eligible medical purchases and commuter expenses
* 403(b) retirement plan; Zeta offers matching contributions toward your savings
* Competitive compensation


**We provide awesome perks:**


* MacBook Air
* Zeta swag
* Specified monthly reimbursement for use of mobile phone
* Fully stocked teacher workrooms with favorite snacks and Nespresso machine
* NYC's finest sweet treats
* Team outings


**We care deeply about your personal and professional growth:**


* Clear pathway to professional growth
* Consistent feedback and support from managers and teammates
* Community Circle practice to build and strengthen our sense of team
* Interactive Mindfulness and DEIJ programming

### **Apply Now!**



Equity is at the heart of our mission. We have a deep commitment to pursuing diversity and striving for equity. Zeta is an equal opportunity employer. title: Manager of Affordable Housing
description:
**Overview**

Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, leasing, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity.

We're on the lookout for a passionate and driven individual to join our team as a Manager of Affordable Housing. In this crucial position, you will play a key role in influencing the progress, oversight, and coordination of our affordable housing programs. Your dedication will directly contribute to ensuring residents have access to safe, high-quality homes that align with their financial means. Join us in making a meaningful impact on communities by fostering sustainable and accessible housing solutions!

**Essential Job Functions**

* The Affordable Housing Manager will be primarily responsible for overseeing the recertification process, ensuring its timeliness, approving and verifying that all move in files adhere to compliance regulations set by state and local programs, but not limited to tax credits, HPD, HFA, Section 8, HCR and SOTA.
* Supervise and guide Affordable Housing Associates.
* Maintain and manage applicant waiting list.
* Maintaining the recertification tracker to ensure timely completion of all assigned and certifications.
* Running Yardi Annual recertification reports and developing a plan of action with the team on proactively organizing and completing certifications.
* Ensure utility allowances, LIHTC and HUD increases are filed timely and correct data is being used throughout portfolio.
* Lead and direct team to meet all compliance needs, including recertifications, rent registrations and lease renewals.
* Meet with team on weekly basis to discuss needs for the department and conduct trainings.
* Ensure accurate lease information, including rates, agency details, apartment specs, and financial terms.
* Prepare subsidy paperwork and input initial leases, renewals, and credits (e.g., SCRIE, DRIE, Section 8) in Yardi.
* Assist team in interviewing applicants, assess income requirements and document external income sources.
* Assist in monthly, quarterly, and annual report preparation for government agencies.
* Take charge of preparing for any state agency or Syndicator audits that may occur.
* Conduct regular audits, ensuring compliance with income restrictions, guidelines, and government housing programs, while staying informed to maintain audit-ready files and acting as a liaison between ownership, state agencies, and managers.
* Address tenant inquiries promptly and compassionately, building positive resident relationships while adhering to fair-housing laws and regulations.
* Must be present on-site, with the ability to move throughout the office, ensuring effective communication with tenants, staff, and visitors.
* Position may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities as needed.

**Qualifications**

* A minimum of 3 years of work experience in affordable housing including LIHTC, local programs and rent stabilization.
* Proficiency in navigating computers and property management software to include Microsoft Office Suite and On-Site.
* Previous supervisory experience, a plus.
* Extensive experience with Yardi software including Rent Café Affordable Housing and managing Section-8 compliance.
* Possess fundamental math skills, along with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with practical experience in data entry.
* Valid NYS real estate license or ability to obtain one within the first 120 days of employment. All active license holders must register their license with Rose Associates upon hire.
* LIHTC certification (must be obtained within the first year of employment and maintained).
* Work authorization (required)

In addition to base compensation, full benefits packages are available.

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Will you now or in the future require sponsorship to work in the United States?
* Are you fully vaccinated against COVID-19?
* What is your desired base salary?

Work Location: In person

title: Commercial Sales Manager
description:
Overview: **Western Pest Services** is a premier *provider* of pest control solutions. Western Pest Services protects more than just homes and business in our area. The homeowners know us as the local brand to get the job done and businesses know us as the local brand that will protect their brand. Getting the job done with great services is what we are all about. Internally, we work to keep our work family safe, to provide them with the tools to help them grown, and to keep it fun. **Established in 1928,** we have a legacy of excellence and the stability of an industry leader.  

We are currently seeking a **Commercial Sales Manager** based out of Parsippany, NJ.  


Responsibilities:

Western Pest Services is looking for an energetic sales leader to develop a dynamic commercial/B2B sales region. This role will manage teams based out of West Orange, Mountainside, Paramus, Morris , Monmouth and Princeton. If you’re a positive professional who enjoys making personal connections with your customers, independence, having fun, and keeping businesses in our area safe and healthy, then this Region Sales Manager job is for you. With a competitive compensation package, a comprehensive benefits package, company vehicle and smartphone, and more, the reasons why your next career should be in pest control go on and on. It’s about more than just pest control, though. We are in the business of public health and safety, and you can be proud to be a part of that.  

As a Sales Manager with Western Pest Services, after you complete our industry-leading training, you will use that knowledge to lead a team of salespeople to achieve their sales goals. You will also perform inspections, present proposals, and help close sales. The Commercial Sales Manager will be responsible for attracting, developing, and retaining talented employees. You will also create sales opportunities to drive new sales revenue resources, while providing ongoing training and development to the sales team. If you possess the ability to analyze business trends, identify sales opportunities, and provide direction for growth, then you should apply today. **We Offer…*** **Competitive Compensation:** **Minimum b****ase salary of $100,000 plus bonuses.**
* Comprehensive benefit package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401K, stock purchase, tuition reimbursement, and more!
* Paid Time Off (Holiday/Vacation/Sick)
* **Company Vehicle & Gas Card**
* Paid Training/Industry Orientation
* Smartphone, Equipment, etc.
* Opportunities for Growth, Development, and Advancement

**Basic Qualifications**

* 5-7 Years of Sales Management Experience
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Strong Leadership Skills
* Able to Lead a Team of Salespeople
* Knowledge of CRM, Power Point, Excel and Other Sales Programs
* Driver’s License
* Team Oriented
* Courteous
* Customer Focus
* Listening
* Customer Service
* Team Player

 **Physical Demands / Working Environment:*** Safely use a ladder within the manufacturer's weight capacity
* Lift and carry up to 50 lbs.
* Safely access crawl spaces, attics, confined spaces, roof tops, etc.
* Ability to work in all types of weather conditions

  

Salary Range: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

title: Director, NA Digital Marketing
description:
Michael Kors is always interested in hearing from talented, globally-minded individuals with a passion for fashion.
If you enjoy working in a creative, fast-paced environment, then we would love to hear from you!
Who You Are:
You are energetic, collaborative, have strong communication and are results driven. You are a leader who thrives in a rapidly changing environment and have extensive digital marketing experience. You also have experience fostering a team culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
As our Director, Digital Marketing, you will lead the development and optimization of our digital strategy to drive business growth across all channels, including paid search, organic search, affiliate marketing, paid social, performance influencer, and display. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute customer-centric initiatives that enhance acquisition, conversion, and retention. Your role will involve optimizing campaigns to maximize ROAS, exploring innovative marketing approaches, managing agency partnerships, and supporting retail-focused digital strategies.
What You’ll Do:* Lead strategy and manage all digital marketing channels supporting ecommerce business and in-store initiatives ensuring campaigns are driving qualified traffic at an optimized ROAS. Channel responsibility includes: paid search, shopping, organic search, affiliate marketing, paid social, and display.
* Manage development of marketing channel plans and goals to meet performance targets and ensure alignment with fiscal budgets and forecasts.
* Manage and optimize channels to hit sales targets effectively and efficiently; optimize and structure existing channels with the latest best practices and continuously test new acquisition strategies and tactics
* Develop strategies and implementation plans for new program initiatives with a focus on a more personalized one-to-one customer relationship and specific customer journeys across multi touchpoints to lead customer-focused marketing initiatives designed to drive improved conversion and retention
* Mastery of leading ad industry tools & technologies and ability to partner internally to drive expert outcomes – required constant exploration of innovative approaches and opportunities
* Test and improve campaign creative, copy, and audience targeting/segmentation to ensure campaign optimization
* Analyze results of all campaigns, using learnings to optimize campaign performance and set future test plans, create and refine actionable audience targets and promotions. Synthesize information to clearly communicate key learnings, actionable strategy, and recommend new opportunities to leadership.
* Identify new sources of customer acquisition and profit via new partners new strategies and emerging channels.
* Manage external agency partners, conduct agency reviews and select agency partners as needed
* Support retail & outlet marketing teams with specific drive to store digital strategies and tactics
* Partner closely with cross-functional teams (CRM, Retail Marketing, Brand Marketing, Merchandising, Creative, etc.) to develop industry leading campaigns that lean into full funnel marketing strategies tied to clear measurement KPIs. Ensure proper messaging, timing and execution of campaigns across paid channels in alignment with site and retention marketing teams.
* Partner closely with the Brand Team to develop performance influencer campaigns that drive brand/product engagement, traffic, and sales.
* Lead and mentor team to consistently driving learning, growth, and innovative thinking.


You’ll Need to Have:* Bachelor's degree required
* 8+ years of digital marketing experience for a brand with a heavy focus on paid search/paid social social/affiliate – strong performance (ROAS-focused) marketing experience required
* Retail industry experience required
* Proven ability to manage large multi-million-dollar budgets
* Strong analytical skills, comfortable using data to drive decision-making
* Solid knowledge of the complete digital marketing landscape and a history of success managing digital marketing programs that drive business results
* Proven ability to effectively manage agency partners
* Hands-on experience working with: Adobe Analytics, Google AdWords, Affiliate marketing platforms and other relevant marketing systems


We’d Like to See:* Ability to lead thinking and develop strategy but willing to be hands-on as needed
* Strong problem-solving skills, especially when dealing with ambiguity
* Excellent oral and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills


MK Perks:* Generous PTO & Holiday Schedule
* Summer Fridays
* Internal mobility across Versace, Jimmy Choo, and Michael Kors
* Cross-brand Discount
* Exclusive Employee Sales
* Fav 5 Cards (MK Discount for friends and family)
* 401k Match
* Paid Parental Leave
* Thrive Wellness Program (seasonal in-office massages and more!)
* Commuter Benefits
* Gym Discounts

title: Vice President, Growth Operations
description:
**ABOUT ORCHESTRA**



Orchestra is the first communications company built for the new media landscape. Since early 2022, it has grown into a network of eight strategic communications and marketing agencies including BerlinRosen, Brightmode, Derris, Glen Echo Group, Inkhouse, M18, Message Lab, and Onward, with more than 600 storytellers and strategists from 12 cities across North America and Europe. The network of leading agency partners works with companies, organizations and business leaders across high-growth industries including consumer, climate and sustainability, education, healthcare, real estate and technology.



From leading technological innovators, to brand-builders and cause champions, we work with our clients and offer unparalleled expertise on how to craft a story-first, audience-focused approach to solve their most pressing challenges.



People of color, people with disabilities and women are strongly encouraged to apply. Orchestra is committed to building and maintaining a diverse staff, and recognizes that its continued success depends on hiring and retaining high-quality creative professionals with a variety of backgrounds and experiences. Opportunities for advancement exist, and we are committed to helping all staff develop and grow.

  


**ABOUT THIS ROLE**



The 10+ person Growth team is responsible for shaping Orchestra's new business and growth strategy, focusing on integrating capabilities across firms, driving new business outreach and providing expert counsel on how to shape business growth for new and current clients across Orchestra and Orchestra companies.



Orchestra is seeking a VP or SVP of Growth Operations to join our Growth team. This role will focus on developing new strategic systems and protocols to lift up the work of the Growth team. It will provide the foundation to scale the Growth function and center its strategic role as Orchestra continues to expand. The person best suited to this role will be a motivated self-starter, ideally with strong backgrounds in business development, systems-building and project management. This is an exciting role for a person looking to build a new approach and work at the center of strategic decision-making for a rapidly expanding company and its business development function. This person will report directly to the Head of Growth at Orchestra.



Please note that this role is not a sales job and is internal to the Orchestra network (not client facing).


**Role location:** This role is based in our New York, N.Y. office on a hybrid basis. Orchestra staff are in-office 3 days per week.

  


**ACCOUNTABILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS**



As a VP/SVPof Growth Operationson the Growth team, you will…


* Develop, implement and train on systems, databases, process and protocols for new business across Orchestra and Orchestra companies and be a link between new business and marketing strategies
* Support the big picture business development strategy across Orchestra and Orchestra companies
* Lead multiple projects at once while engaging with many different people and personalities, coordinating between teams and firms, researching new projects, project-managing business development integrations and managing programs to support Growth team expansion and infrastructure
* Partner with all Orchestra companies on coordinated business development systems
* Collaborate closely with firm management teams to develop and inspire growing teams of strategists to be innovative and creative in our business development endeavors
* Directly manage and mentor staff, and provide overall strategic direction and feedback for their development and work (note, there is currently one direct report for this position)
* A little further down the line: shape and scale initiatives for client upsells, expansions and retention


**Essential skills:**


* 7-10+ years of professional experience in business development, ideally at a communications or marketing agency
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize work streams and track progress across multiple teams
* Expert multitasking skills with the ability to handle multiple projects at once, work quickly and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment with high attention to detail
* Experience in leading and mentoring a diverse team and a demonstrated ability to successfully motivate, manage and mentor teams to meet objectives
* Track record of successfully creating scalable processes and solutions
* In-depth experience with a variety of business development tools, systems and processes (ideally including having led the implementation of them)


**Preferred skills:**


* Experience in client relations—whether it's been in professional services, technology and innovation, political campaigns or more, we appreciate candidates from all professional backgrounds and are excited to incorporate your myriad of experiences into our work


**Note: Interested in this role but it's not quite the right match? Applicants who meet some but not all** ***or*** **exceed the above criteria are still encouraged to apply! We are eager to speak with candidates with diverse backgrounds and can assess role leveling on an individual basis.**

  


**WORKING AT ORCHESTRA**


**Salary range** (commensurate with experience and skills):


* Vice President: $130,000-$170,000
* Senior Vice President: $170,000-$215,000


This role is eligible for end of year bonuses based on firm, team and individual performance.


**Benefits:**


* Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees and dependents
* Pre-tax Health Savings Account Savings Plan (HSA-SP) or Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* 401K with a 4% employer match and no vesting period
* Generous paid time off (PTO)
+ 20 vacation days, 10 wellness days, 1 day for your birthday, collective PTO between Christmas and New Year's Day, plus 11 holidays

* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* Mobile phone reimbursement for data and minutes
* Employer-funded life insurance
* Discounted annual bikeshare membership
* Corporate discounts through Tickets at Work


#LI-JC1  

#LI-Hybrid

  


We're part of Orchestra, the first communications company built for today's media landscape. Since early 2022, it has grown into a network of eight strategic communications and marketing agencies including BerlinRosen, Derris, Glen Echo Group, Inkhouse, M18, Message Lab, Onward and Brightmode.


*To ensure that applicants are matched with the job that best suits their qualifications and interests, information that you submit may be shared with our network agencies.* *By providing your information, you are consenting to allow us and our subsidiaries to keep your information on file and to contact you regarding job opportunities, recruitment events and other related updates.*

title: Tour Planner
description:
**Company Overview:** EDU Trips is a leading tour operator specializing in creating unforgettable travel experiences for Students and school groups around the globe. We are passionate about curating unique itineraries that cater to a wide range of interests, from cultural immersions to adventurous explorations. As a growing company, we are looking for a creative and detail-oriented Tour Planner to join our dynamic team.

**Job Summary:** As a Tour Planner, you will be responsible for designing, organizing, and coordinating custom travel itineraries for our clients. You will work closely with clients to understand their preferences, budget, and expectations, and then craft a personalized travel experience that exceeds their expectations. Your role will involve researching destinations, coordinating logistics, and ensuring that every detail of the trip is meticulously planned.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Client Consultation:** Engage with clients to understand their travel preferences, needs, and budget.
* **Itinerary Design:** Develop detailed and creative itineraries that include accommodations, activities, transportation, and other travel services.
* **Vendor Coordination:** Collaborate with hotels, tour guides, transportation providers, and other service vendors to arrange bookings and ensure seamless travel experiences.
* **Cost Management:** Prepare cost estimates for itineraries and manage budgets effectively, ensuring value for both the client and the company.
* **Travel Documentation:** Assist clients with travel documentation, including visas, travel insurance, and other required permits.
* **Quality Assurance:** Review all travel arrangements to ensure they meet the company's high standards of service and quality.
* **Problem Solving:** Address any issues or concerns that arise during the planning or execution of the tour.
* **Market Research:** Stay updated on travel trends, new destinations, and emerging travel experiences to offer innovative options to clients.
* **Client Relationship Management:** Build and maintain strong relationships with clients to encourage repeat business and referrals.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** 2+ years of experience in travel planning, tourism, or a related field. (Preferred but not required).
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Tourism, Hospitality Management, Communications, English or a related field (preferred but not required). Recent and soon to be graduates are welcome to apply.
* **Skills:**
* Strong organizational skills with keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills.
* Ability to multitask and manage multiple clients simultaneously.
* Familiar with Google work space (Google sheets, Docs, Presentations)
* Knowledge of global travel destinations and cultural nuances.
* Problem-solving skills and the ability to remain calm under pressure.

**Preferred Attributes:**

* Passionate about travel and creating exceptional travel experiences.
* Creative thinker with a knack for crafting unique and memorable itineraries.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary.
* Opportunities for travel and familiarization trips.
* Paid time off and holiday pay

**How to Apply:** Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume along with a cover letter detailing their experience and why they are the ideal candidate for this position to [email address]. Please include "Tour Planner Application" in the subject line.

Join our team and help us create journeys of a lifetime for our clients!

title: International Marketing Manager
description:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.


**What you'll be part of:**



Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

**What you'll be responsible for:**



Circle is seeking a highly motivated and experienced International Marketing Manager who will execute our global marketing initiatives spanning multiple audiences, channels, and geographies. This person will play a pivotal role in driving our international marketing channel execution and expanding the global footprint of our brand and products. This position requires a strategic mindset, a deep understanding of diverse markets, and a passion for developing local marketing initiatives. The International Marketing Manager will lead cross-functional teams executing targeted initiatives to engage audiences in our top priority markets.


**What you'll work on:**


* **Country-Specific Marketing Strategy:** Aid in the development and implementation of integrated marketing campaigns to support business objectives. This will include helping plan and execute parts of country-launch events, activations, and more.
* **Localization & Translation:** Help develop our localization and translation approach for marketing materials to ensure cultural relevance and effective communication in different regions including content, website, and campaign assets.
* **Influencer Marketing:** Develop and execute influencer marketing strategies to enhance brand awareness and reach target audiences globally.
* **Agency Management:** Build and maintain relationships with agencies in all of our priority markets.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Collaborate with demand generation, product marketing, and other teams to align marketing efforts and drive business growth globally including Marketing, Business, Internationalization, and our Legal teams.
* **Analytics and Reporting:** Monitor and analyze marketing performance metrics to track the effectiveness of our global marketing initiatives and optimize strategies for continuous improvement. outcomes, and identified opportunities.


**You will aspire to our four core values:**


* **Multistakeholder -** you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees & families, and local communities.
* **Mindful -** you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
* **Driven by Excellence -** you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
* **High Integrity -** you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty, and intolerance.


**What you'll bring to Circle:**


* 5+ years of experience in Global Marketing, Influencer Marketing, Campaign Marketing or Partner Marketing preferred.
* Expertise in B2B campaign and/or B2B2C design and deployment, message development & results analysis, and reporting at a global scale.
* Proven track record of developing and executing successful marketing in diverse markets.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing channels, including SEO, SEM, social media, and email marketing.
* Exceptional collaboration skills and the ability to credibly engage with cross-functional leaders to drive results.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Ownership and accountability of multi-channel in market initiatives and programs.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills, including strong verbal, listening, and written communication.
* Demonstrated success navigating complex business environments and driving efficient and effective execution.
* Experience/familiarity with 6Sense, Seismic, HubSpot, Slack, Apple MacOS, and GSuite preferred.
* An appetite for work travel.
* Fluency in oral and written English. Bi-lingual is a plus.


**Additional Information:**


* This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.


*Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.*


*Starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.*


*Base Pay Range: $130,000 - $170,000*


*Annual Bonus Target: 15%*


*Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.*


We are an **equal opportunity employer** and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the **E-Verify Program** in certain locations, as required by law.


###### 
#LI-Remote

title: Facilitator
description:
Program sites located in the Bronx

$15-$25

**Position Summary:**

At Children’s Aid, we believe that all kids have limitless potential. Our dedicated staff provide comprehensive supports for nearly 50,000 children and families in targeted, under-resourced New York City neighborhoods. We know what it takes to ensure children grow up strong and healthy, and ready to thrive in school and life: excellent education and health care, social-emotional support, and strong, stable families.

The facilitator is responsible for the supervision and care of (up to) 20 children, which comprise a group or club. A facilitator is a leader who commits to teaching by modeling and demonstrating characteristics that participants can learn from. The facilitator will work to support the Program Director by supporting afterschool staff with lesson planning, lesson implementation, curriculum design and training during and for the afterschool staff.

**Essential Duties:**

* Provide supervision and care of (up to) 20 elementary and middle school participants which comprise a group or club.
* Develop lesson plans aligned with the standards of project-based learning, teach, supervise, and organize games.
* Provide individual and group tutoring in areas such as reading, writing, mathematics, and study skills.
* Demonstrate and develop effective classroom and behavioral management skills.
* Communicate regularly with the Program Director and/or Education Coordinator in regard to lesson planning and implementation.
* Implement a professionally developed literacy-based curriculum.
* Help design and lead the implementation of special projects in and out of program.
* Assist in establishing, monitoring, and maintaining safe and respectful behavior of participants.
* Attend regular staff meetings, trainings and work cooperatively with other staff members in the program and in the schools.
* Assist in activities or tasks necessary to ensure an orderly operation of the program: supervise children during meals, ensuring equipment is properly signed out and that all equipment is properly cleaned and returned.
* Work cooperatively with other staff members of the program (may include late nights and/or weekends).
* Establish and maintain rapport with the students and parents.
* In-person collaboration is an essential function of the job.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* High school diploma required
* At least one year of experience working with children, tutoring, or teaching.

**Key Competencies:**

* Work well in teams and in collaboration with other organizations and entities.
* Strong communication skills and well-organized.
* Bilingual preferred (Spanish/English, oral and written).
* Must be punctual, responsible, have a positive attitude and encourage children.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 25 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* After school
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have at least one year of experience working with children, tutoring, or teaching?
* Can you work between the hours of 2pm-6pm?

Work Location: In person

title: Store Event Coordinator
description:
**Are you ready to bring your amazing self to work?**

At Macy's, Inc., we're on a mission to create a brighter future with bold representation for all. This is our Mission Everyone. We know that each person here is unique. We respect and invest in each individual to create growth, pride and satisfaction. If we are able to bring our whole selves to work, it translates into a more abundant and wider array of ideas and energy for all to benefit from. Our success will be built on amazing colleagues, working together.

**Job Summary**

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and administratively savvy Event Coordinator to join our in-store team. This role requires a strategic thinker with a strong operational background, capable of designing and executing events that drive customer engagement and enhance the shopping experience.

If you are a passionate, operationally focused event coordinator looking to make your mark in a fast-paced retail setting, we would love to hear from you!

**What we can offer you**

* An inclusive, challenging, and refreshingly fun work environment
* Empowerment to perform impactful work with tangible results
* Coverage across medical, dental, vision, and retirement
* Employee Assistance Program (mental health and financial literacy resources)
* Fully-Funded education benefits may include 100% of tuition, books, and fees
* Merchandise discounts
* Colleague Resource Groups (CRGs), give-back/volunteer opportunities

**What you will do**

* Develop and implement event strategies that align with the store's goals and brand image
* Oversee all aspects of event planning, including concept development, logistics, sourcing vendor partnership, staffing, execution, and administrative duties of tracking of events and paperwork for both in-store and offsite events
* Ensure operational excellence by managing event budgets, schedules, models, rentals, materials, and vendor contracts/partnerships effectively
* Collaborate with store management and key partners to determine event sales goals and integrate events seamlessly into daily functions, maximizing efficiency and customer flow
* Leverage clientelling tools, partnerships with local influencers to form awareness and promote events
* Analyze event performance, providing reports on metrics, and making recommendations for improvements
* Identify opportunities within the market calendar and external market area to enhance outreach and drive sales traffic
* Complete tasks to support event execution, such as picking products and setting up point of sale equipment while following asset protection controls and compliance procedures

**Who you are**

* Proven track record in event coordination with a focus on operational excellence within a retail environment.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple events simultaneously
* Exceptional organizational abilities and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively across departments.
* Strong analytical and logical thought process and with creative problem-solving skills.
* Flexibility to work retail hours, including weekends and holidays, as event schedules require.
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred.

**Essential Physical Requirements**

* Regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking. May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, or crouch.
* Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
* Frequent use of computers and handheld electronic equipment.
* Reaching, including above eye level, crouching, kneeling, stooping and color vision.
* Lifting and moving items weighing up to 25 lbs.
* 50% Travel due to supporting multiple stores within a market.

**About Macy's**

Now is an exciting time for a Macy's career as we continue to focus on creating exciting and memorable experiences for every Macy's customer, whether their journey starts online or in the store. Our opportunities in Sales, Merchandise, Operations, Customer Service, Warehouse, Marketing, and other areas let you express your creativity and commitment to excellence, grow your career and make a difference to your Macy's colleagues and customers.

***Bring your creativity, energy and ideas to the Macy's team – Apply Today!*** 

STORES00

* This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses. Benefits include 401k, medical/vision/dental/life/disability insurance options, PTO accruals, Holidays, and more. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Click here to see details on benefits.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.90 - $34.65 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Events management: 1 year (Preferred)
* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Garden City, NY 11530 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Garden City, NY 11530: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Travel Registered Nurse, Medsurg
description:
Job Title: Medsurg, Registered Nurse (RN)

Location: Bronx, NY

Blended Rate: $2200/wk

Shift: 3x11.5s - 34.5hrs - Nights - 7p to 7a

**Job Description:**

We are seeking an experienced and compassionate Medsurg Registered Nurse (RN) to join our healthcare team in Bronx, NY. If you are a dedicated professional with strong clinical skills and a passion for patient care, this is a rewarding opportunity to make a difference in the lives of others.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide exceptional nursing care to patients in the Medical-Surgical (Medsurg) unit.
* Assess patient needs, develop and implement individualized care plans, and evaluate patient responses based on established protocols.
* Monitor vital signs, administer medications, and perform other nursing procedures as required.
* Collaborate with physicians, interdisciplinary teams, and family members to ensure coordinated and comprehensive patient care.
* Educate patients and their families on disease management, treatment plans, and self-care techniques.
* Maintain accurate medical records, including patient histories, nursing care plans, and medication administration records.
* Adhere to infection control and safety protocols, maintaining a clean and organized environment.
* Participate in quality improvement initiatives, providing input and suggestions for process enhancements.
* Stay updated on current nursing practices, attending educational seminars, workshops, and conferences as required.
* Consistently demonstrate professionalism, empathy, and respect for patients, families, and colleagues.

**Requirements:**

* Active Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of New York.
* Minimum of 2 years of Medsurg nursing experience.
* BLS certification (ACLS preferred) from a recognized organization.
* Strong clinical assessment and critical thinking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic healthcare environment.
* Proficiency in using electronic medical records and other healthcare software.

Join our dedicated team and contribute to the valuable work of improving the health and well-being of our patients in the Medsurg unit. Apply today and begin your rewarding career as a Medsurg Registered Nurse!

**Working for Seven Healthcare:**

Seven Healthcare is one of the USA's most popular agencies for Medsurg, RN jobs. Rated ‘Excellent’ on Trustpilot from 1900+ reviews, and with 20 major awards behind us, we take pride in knowing we can find you the best possible rates in a role you can be proud of.

title: HR Payroll & Invoice Specialist
description:
HR Payroll & Invoice Specialist
**Job Title: HR Payroll & Invoice Specialist**


**Carter Lard Consulting - Staffing and Shelter Housing**


**Location: Mostly Remote with the ability to travel into New York City if required**

**Salary: $65k-80k**


**Job Type: Full time**

**Job Summary: The HR Payroll & Invoice Specialist will be responsible for managing payroll, responding to employee inquiries and creating monthly invoices for our clients. This role requires someone with a strong attention, who can maintain accurate payroll records, ensure compliance with relevant laws, and process invoices efficiently. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, be detail oriented, and have the ability to work collaboratively within a fast-paced environment.**


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Payroll Administration:**


* **Process our alternating bi-weekly payrolls in a timely and accurate manner.**
* **Ensure employee data such as hire dates; terminations salary adjustments are kept up to date processed correctly in our payroll system Paychex.**
* **Make sure proper deductions are set up and being taken from employee's paychecks including tax withholding, benefit deductions and garnishments**
* **Verify and address any timesheet issues and make sure timesheets are accurate on a weekly basis**
* **Manage employees PTO time, making sure they are set up with accurate PTO accrual profiles, and tracking employees who request time off by adding it to a PTO Calendar and confirming employees are paid for this time**
* **Maintain accurate payroll records and prepare payroll reports as needed.**
* **Respond to employee inquiries regarding their time sheet, PTO, Pay and other issues**
* **Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll regulations and tax laws.**
* **Prepare and submit payroll tax filings and reports as required.**
* **Assist with audits by providing necessary documentation and information.**
* **Stay updated on changes in payroll laws and regulations.**
* **Assist with HR-related tasks as needed**

**Invoice Processing:**


* **Create and process monthly invoices for our clients in a timely and accurate manner**
* **Address client concerns regarding invoices and reconcile/resolve any discrepancies**
* **Maintain organized records of all invoices and payments.**
* **Assist with monthly and year-end financial closing processes related to invoices.**
* **Support the finance team with any additional administrative duties.**

**Qualifications:**


* **Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Accounting, Finance, or a related field preferred.**
* **3-5 years' experience processing payroll and invoicing**
* **Experience with Paychex and QuickBooks preferred**
* **Staffing firm experience preferred**
* **Strong understanding of payroll and accounting principles.**
* **Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word)**
* **Excellent organizational and time-management skills.**
* **Strong attention to detail and accuracy.**
* **Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.**

title: Veterinarian
description:
**Veterinarian**



Northside Veterinary Clinic is hiring a [full-time] [vet type] Veterinarian toprovide comprehensive medical, surgical, and dental care



to a variety of animal patients, including [insert specificity as needed, i.e.: exotic, reptiles, livestock, etc.]


**What to Expect**


**Salary:** **$135K-$150K** per year


**Sign-on Bonus:** Yes


**Location:** 233 Berry Street Brooklyn, NY 11249


**Hours of operation:**


* Monday: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
* Tuesday: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
* Wednesday: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
* Thursday: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
* Friday: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
* Saturday: 9:00 am - 4:00 pm
* Sunday: Closed


**As you join our mission:**



Our primary focus is supporting our patient's health and wellness journey through preventative pet medicine at any season of life. Services offered at NVC include wellness exams, vaccinations and parasite prevention/treatment, pet dental exams, spaying/neutering, diagnostics, holistic and alternative care, surgical procedures, euthanasia, companion laser therapy, and more. Our onsite laboratory allows us to expedite your pet's test results, even during their appointment slot. We also offer emergency treatment services and have a veterinarian on call for emergencies every day from 7 am to 10 pm. If you prefer a more integrated medical approach to your pet's care, holistic or alternative medical treatments are available at NVC. Our highly experienced team offers treatments such as acupuncture, craniosacral therapy, and traditional Chinese medicine.


* **A schedule that respects your time**
* **All the benefits you deserve—health, dental, vision, retirement—plus**
* **Paid time off**
* **Partnership opportunities through Veterinary Practice Partners (VPP),** where more than 125 vet's co-own practices across 138 locations. VPP offers unmatched support in operations, marketing, and finance, allowing you to focus on your passion for veterinary medicine.


**A Word from Dr. Daniel Leiman Owner**



"I believe each patient is a distinct individual, and tailor my recommendations based on the age, breed, and conformation of that particular animal. My two guiding principles are from the writings of Hippocrates - first, do no harm, and let food be your first medicine."


**About** Northside Veterinary Clinic has been proudly serving Williamsburg, Brooklyn since 1997. When we opened our doors 25 years ago, our dream of becoming the first integrative veterinary clinic in Williamsburg became a reality. Since then, our team has gone above and beyond to practice medicine while staying true to the beliefs our foundation was built upon. Every patient is entitled to treatment rooted in care, respect and understanding. We have built upon those core values to create a full-service, state-of-the-art animal hospital and trusted staple of our community.

title: Lead Veterinary Technician
description:
**Seeking an independent, compassionate, and Licensed** **Technician** **to join and lead our team!**


**Why** **Pure Paws Veterinary Care of Hell's Kitchen** **in** **NY****,** **NY****?**
We're focused on making sure our hospital has the right tools to allow our doctor and medical staff the ability to provide excellent service and care. In addition to diagnostic and preventative services, our hospitals are equipped with digital radiography, digital dental radiography, and in-house labs. Our Hell's Kitchen location is also equipped with a cold laser.

**Our team wants you to know...**
"We are always laughing and finding ways to have fun, even on the most stressful days. Maybe it's silly, but we've started giving each other nicknames based off of the personalities of some of our French Bulldog patients. It's always fun to joke around and debate!"

**Our Commitment to Diversity:**
We are dedicated to establishing a culture that celebrates all forms of diversity and allows us to be an inclusive service provider in this community.

**Who are we looking for?**
Applicants must have an active veterinary technician license, surgery and monitoring anesthesia experience, strong work ethic, preserve a positive personality, capable of communicating effectively, be able to multi-task efficiently in a fast paced environment, have the ability to work in harmony with a team, possess a well-rounded technical skill set, and have a passion for delivering exceptional care to patients as well as clients. The ideal candidate will possess skills such as client service, communication, people management, and problem solving.

**Pay:**
Hourly pay is $36-$40/hr based on experience and skill set.

**Schedule:**  

This is a full time need at 30-40 hours/week. Must have a flexible schedule as we are open 7 days a week.

**Responsibilities:**
* Assist the veterinarian in exam rooms and use veterinary software for documenting medical notes
* Perform venipuncture for phlebotomy and catheter placement
* Obtain laboratory sample collection, process and possibly interpret results (fecal/parasite analysis, ear cytology, skin cytology, urinalysis, blood smears)
* Perform diagnostic imaging

* Prep patients for and assist in surgery
* Perform dental prophies
* Administer vaccines and medications (oral, topical, injectable)

We're dedicated to your well-being and offer a comprehensive package and professional development opportunities to support your work and home life. These include:
* Competitive salary
