title: Director, Compensation
description:
The People Operations team at Clover is a passionate group committed to transforming healthcare and enhancing people's lives, a challenging yet rewarding mission! We provide guidance, support, and innovative programs to empower our teams, ensuring they thrive in their roles. It's an immense responsibility, and we're privileged to do it.



We're looking for a Director of Compensation, to spearhead the development and execution of Clover's global compensation strategy to attract and retain top talent. You'll oversee all aspects of our compensation programs, including salary structures, equity awards, and additional incentives. With a focus on innovation, transparency, and creative thinking, you'll conduct market analysis, build a talented team, and implement communication strategies to empower employees and drive organizational success.

  

**As a Director, Compensation, you will:**


* Develop, implement, and manage a comprehensive compensation strategy aimed at attracting and retaining top talent, ensuring pay equity and driving performance across all programs, including salary structures, equity awards, and other incentives.
* Oversee ongoing employee compensation programs, including bonuses, market reviews, biannual promotion processes, and equity refresh cycles, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as HR, Talent, Finance, Legal, and vendors, to provide subject matter expertise, manage stock plan administration, and drive various compensation and total reward initiatives.
* Lead the short and long-term compensation strategy and execution, including job leveling, career-pathing, attraction, retention, reward and recognition, and incentive design to support organizational objectives and employee development.
* Cultivate a high-performing team by providing mentorship, removing roadblocks, and fostering a culture of growth, innovation, and collaboration.


**Success in this role looks like:**


* Within the first 60 days, you have seamlessly integrated into the compensation and total rewards team, actively spearheading compensation initiatives and assuming responsibility for critical operational functions. You have also started to establish strong relationships with key stakeholders across Clover, fostering collaboration and understanding of compensation strategies.
* By the end of your 90-day period, you have demonstrated a deep understanding of the compensation and HR frameworks at Clover, exhibit autonomous leadership in team management and are consistently meeting both internal and external objectives.
* By 6 months, you will be immersed and leading the redesign and implementation of key compensation programs and actively contributing to broader talent management initiatives.
* Future success in this role will be measured through employee engagement and understanding of our compensation programs, talent retention rates, compliance audits, and feedback from peers and senior leadership, ensuring ongoing alignment of compensation strategies. Continued success in this role involves ongoing improvement of the foundational compensation framework, combined with strategic business partnership. This includes consulting with leadership up to and including the board. It also expands to everything from identifying white space opportunities ranging from workforce planning and geolocation strategies, to incentive design in an evolving corporate landscape.


**You should get in touch if:**


* You have 12+ years of relevant compensation experience, including 5+ years in senior leadership positions where you've demonstrated success in **equity compensation management** within complex and fast-paced environments.
	+ *Public company experience required.* Experience in the technology and/or health tech industries preferred but not required.
* You have in-depth knowledge of **global compensation principles, regulations, and market trends**, complemented by proficiency in utilizing platforms such as ADP, Radford, Mercer, BetterComp, E\\*Trade or similar systems and tools.
* You're excited to be at the forefront of redesigning our compensation programs, leveraging your expertise to **shape and refine strategies** across multiple business units.
* You have excellent **leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills**; essential for fostering team collaboration and driving organizational alignment.
* You have demonstrated the ability to transition seamlessly between individual contributor and leadership roles, embodying a **"player-coach" mindset** to inspire and guide team members toward achieving collective goals.
* You are proficient in leveraging **analytical tools** anddatabases to interpret complex compensation data, identify market trends, and formulate **data-driven and actionable insights.**


**Clover Benefits:**


* **Financial Well-Being**: Our commitment to attracting and retaining top talent begins with a competitive base salary and equity opportunities. Additionally, we offer a performance-based bonus program, 401k matching, and regular compensation reviews to recognize and reward exceptional contributions.
* **Physical Well-Being**: We prioritize the health and well-being of our employees and their families by providing comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage. Your health matters to us, and we invest in ensuring you have access to quality healthcare.
* **Mental Well-Being**: We understand the importance of mental health in fostering productivity and maintaining work-life balance. To support this, we offer initiatives such as No-Meeting Fridays, company holidays, access to mental health resources, and a generous flexible time-off policy.
* *Additional Perks*:
	+ Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offering discounted equity opportunities
	+ Reimbursement for office setup expenses
	+ Remote-first culture, enabling collaboration with global teams
	+ Paid parental leave for all new parents
	+ Plus more!

*LI-Remote*


*Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.* *We are an* *E-Verify* *company.*  

  

A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is $195,000 to $240,000. Final pay is based on several factors including but not limited to internal equity, market data, and the applicant's education, work experience, certifications, etc.

  


**About Clover:** We are reinventing health insurance by combining the power of data with human empathy to keep our members healthier. We believe the healthcare system is broken, so we've created custom software and analytics to empower our clinical staff to intervene and provide personalized care to the people who need it most.



We always put our members first, and our success as a team is measured by the quality of life of the people we serve. Those who work at Clover are passionate and mission-driven individuals with diverse areas of expertise, working together to solve the most complicated problem in the world: healthcare.



From Clover's inception, Diversity & Inclusion have always been key to our success. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds, who share a passion for improving people's lives. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of one's identity. All of our employee's points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility.

title: Front Desk Manager
description:

title: Connectivity Expert - Westfield, NJ
description:
**Alliance Mobile**
Connectivity Expert
Westfield, NJ
**Who is Alliance?**
We are a dynamic and rapidly growing partner of AT&T, their second largest in fact. We are committed to providing exceptional experiences for both guests and team members. We pride ourselves on a supportive and driven work environment that fosters professional and personal growth. With over 30 years in the telecommunications industry and operations across 21 states, Alliance Mobile offers a collaborative, friendly atmosphere, comprehensive rewards, and a focus on growth and development to start or grow your career!
**Perks & Benefits:**
* **Unlimited Earnings:** $15.25-$28/hr (hourly plus commission & bonuses).
* **Benefits:** Enjoy Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Paid Training, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k.
* **Career Advancement:** Access to a universe of tools and resources because your growth powers our success.
* **Exclusive Discounts:** 50% off AT&T service and access to the newest tech gadgets.
* **Friendly Vibes:** A culture where everyone is a friend and where your success is celebrated by all.
* **Extra Perks:** Enjoy a Free Dash Pass for Door Dash, $500 Referral Bonuses, and a Student Reimbursement Program, and more!


**What You'll Do:**
* **Engage and Amaze:** Dive into guest needs with empathy and expertise, crafting tailored solutions that light up their world.
* **Build Connections:** Be the bridge between cutting-edge AT&T tech and the hearts of our guests, ensuring they always feel part of the Alliance family.
* **Grow and Glow:** Embrace the journey of personal and professional growth with our supportive crew, where every day is an opportunity to shine brighter.


**Who You Are:**
* A charismatic connector with a passion for tech and people with 1-3 years in sales or customer service experience.
* A problem-solver with strong communication skills who loves to turn challenges into victories.
* A team player who believes in the power of unity and the thrill of a shared mission with the ability to work evenings, weekends, and holidays.


**Mission:** As a Connectivity Expert, you're not just selling; you're connecting hearts and tech! Your mission is to provide extraordinary experiences, making sure every guest leaves with a smile and the perfect AT&T solution in their pocket.
EEO has been and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at Alliance Mobile, where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex (not limited to sexual harassment), national origin, age, genetic information, disability, military status or application, or any other basis protected by state, federal or other applicable law. This Policy of Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all policies and procedures relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment.
At Alliance Mobile, the safety of our employees and customers remains our top priority. We are committed to following all protective and safe-distancing guidelines required by local & state authorities in response to COVID-19.

title: Second In Command - Milk Bar NYC
description:
Join our dynamic team at Milk Bar as the Second In Command at one of our bustling NYC locations! We are looking for a passionate, driven, and experienced leader who thrives in a fast-paced environment. As the right-hand to the Manager, you'll help ensure smooth operations, deliver exceptional customer experiences, and inspire a team of talented individuals who are as dedicated to our brand as you are. If you're a strong communicator, problem-solver, and have a love for all things Milk Bar, we want to hear from you!

**JOB OVERVIEW**

The Second In Command oversees shifts ensuring the preparation of high quality products in a clean, safe and welcoming Bakery while creating a pleasant work environment with the rest of the team. **Food handler card required (Food Protection Certificate in NYC)**.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

Customer Service

* Demonstrate a commitment to service by prioritizing the guest experience and creating personalized moments.
* Ensure smooth day to day operations during the shift. Foster and promote a strong work culture and #MilkBarLife, and uphold brand service standards.
* Fully understand and exhibit the Milk Bar ethos, embody our core values, inspire celebration, and create real magic. Serve as a brand ambassador both internally and externally.
* Maintain brand identity in all interactions. Address and resolve all customer issues at the Bakery.

Human Resources and Talent Development

* Demonstrate teamwork and motivate others to successfully navigate change and achieve goals while supporting the manager with training and staffing needs
* Share with manager feedback and comments regarding:
* Employee performance.
* Potential hiring needs.
* Suggested product par edits.
* Equipment, product, & special order issues as they arise.
* Weekly goals for yourself, staff, & Bakery improvements.
* Plan of action & solid deadlines for completing the aforementioned goals.
* Customer feedback.
* Submit conversation logs as necessary through Paylocity or any other acceptable system.
* Support the manager with appropriate staffing as needed, such as training, weekly tips, callouts, lateness and more.

Operations & Sales

* Uphold a high standard of bakery operations that ensures a clean, safe, and welcoming environment for guests and team members
* Knowledgeable with menu offerings & company information and identify opportunities to cross and up-sell.- Able to relay this information to customers via phone and in person in a coherent and polite manner.
* Ensure the right products are in the right place and quantity to grow sales and minimize waste
* Process transactions accurately and provide corrective measures for any mistakes and inconsistencies.
* Support the Bakery’s daily/monthly inventory management by using correct tools and methods.
* Ensure all inventory is tracked accurately in Netsuite and all transactions are performed in a timely manner.
* Responsible for the preparation of the most delicious Milk Bar products, always prioritizing taste and quality.
* Ensure team members are utilizing all operational / training materials. Maintain and enforce daily checklists, including but not limited to: temperature logs, FIFO, soft serve, deep clean tasks and AM / PM checklists.
* Be knowledgeable with troubleshooting any and all equipment issues, and minimize the use of external technicians.
* Comply with DOH regulations and Milk Bar GMP standards when performing cleaning tasks, preparing food and beverages, and working behind the counter. Follow company dress code and hygiene practices and standards. Adhere to any current and future Covid19 related regulations.
* Execute all menu changes to perfection and ensure they are properly implemented.
* Performs other duties as assigned by GM/BM, and AGM

Please note that job duties are subject to change at the Bakery’s discretion.

**SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS**

* 1-2 years of supervisory experience required, preferably in the hospitality or food service industry.
* Work a minimum of 4 shifts (32 hours) per week.
* **Food handler card required (Food Protection Certificate in NYC)**
* Strong communication skills. Ability to solve problems independently and delegate as needed.
* Passion for food, sweets and coffee - big plus.
* Must be able to safely lift up to 25 lbs and remain in a stationary position for shifts.
* Regular in-person attendance is an essential function and requirement of this position.

Work Authorization: At this time, Milk Bar is only considering candidates legally authorized to work in the united states. We participate with e- verify™ and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. employers can only use e-verify™ once you have accepted a job offer and completed the form I-9.

EEO Statement: Milk Bar is an equal opportunity employer and shall treat all applicants for employment equally based upon job-related qualifications and without regard to race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, marital status, military or veteran status, national origin, disability, religion, political activity, lawful tobacco use while off-duty, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Weekend Eating Disorder Technician, Residential
description:
**Company Description**  

Discovery Behavioral Health (DBH) is a national leader in behavioral healthcare and one of the fastest growing companies in the field. DBH offers world-class treatment for those struggling with eating, mental health, and substance use disorders, and places a high priority on seeking employees who share our passion for improving the lives we serve.


Since 1997, Center for Discovery, DBH’s eating disorder division, has helped thousands of patients discover their path to the full and rewarding lives they deserve with evidence-based and inclusive treatment options.

**Compensation Range: $16-20/hr**

**Compensation will be dependent upon geographic region, education, and experience**

**Our Offer to You!**


We are dedicated to empowering our teammates with their professional and personal development by providing:

* 401(k)
* Healthcare benefits
* Vacation and sick days
* Employee referral program
* Employee discounts to various stores, amusement parks, events, etc.
* Training in best practices for telehealth
* Continuing education (CE) programs and training
* Weekly training opportunities
* Advancement opportunities within the organization

  

**Job Description** **Eating Disorder Technician** (ED Tech) is responsible for assisting and supporting patients through the entire treatment experience from admission through discharge. ED Tech is responsible for contributing insightful, practical, and meaningful information to the treatment planning process. ED Tech responsibilities primarily include ensuring patient safety, providing milieu interventions, leading psychoeducational groups, and supporting patients.

**Responsibilities**

* Supports patient during admission processes. This may include checking in patient belongings, acclimating patient to the program and milieu.
* Effectively and professionally communicates with families/loved ones, as appropriate.
* Assists and supports patients in day to day activities including, but not limited to: waking routines, morning hygiene, meals, nighttime routine, evening hygiene, bathroom observations, and free time.
* Provides milieu management throughout the treatment experience and communicates with all team members.
* Engages in brief “check ins” wherein patients are provided with support and guidance in using coping skills.
* Responsible for facilitating psychoeducational groups for the expected length of time identified in the program schedule.
* Objectively and accurately documents patient progress on a daily basis.

**This is a part-time position working EVERY OTHER WEEKEND 3-11 PM Sat-Sun.**


For a virtual tour of the facility, please visit our website at centerfordiscovery.com.

 **Qualifications**  

* Experience working in mental health treatment and/or a Bachelor’s or Master's in relevant field
* Must possess a current driver’s license and be in good standing


Not sure if you meet all the qualifications? Apply anyway! To provide truly innovative care, we need to have a diverse team around us. That’s why Discovery Behavioral Health is committed to creating an inclusive environment. If you find yourself meeting some but not all the above, we’d be happy to consider your application.

 **Additional Information**  

We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.


For more information about our company benefits, please visit us at *discoverybehavioralhealth.com/careers/*

**Discovery Behavioral Health seeks to build a diverse staff that is reflective of the patients we serve and the communities where we work. DBH encourages multiple perspectives, experiences, and strives to hire and retain a diverse workforce.**

title: Travel Registered Nurse, Mother Baby
description:
Job Title: Mother Baby, Registered Nurse (RN)

Location: Bronx, NY

Blended Rate: $3060/wk

Shift: Nightshifts - 36hrs

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a skilled and compassionate Mother Baby Registered Nurse (RN) to join our dedicated healthcare team in Bronx, NY. As a Mother Baby RN, you will provide exceptional care to new mothers and their babies during the crucial postpartum period. Your role will involve monitoring the well-being of both mother and baby, providing support and education, and assisting with basic baby care. A friendly and caring demeanor, attention to detail, and excellent communication skills are essential for success in this role.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide high-quality, evidence-based care to mothers and babies during the postpartum period.
* Monitor the physical and emotional well-being of both mother and baby, including assessing vital signs, breastfeeding, wound healing, and general well-being.
* Administer medications, as prescribed, and ensure accurate documentation.
* Educate mothers on postpartum care, breastfeeding techniques, infant care, and promote newborn safety.
* Provide emotional support and reassurance to new mothers, as they adjust to motherhood.
* Assist with newborn screenings and tests.
* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary healthcare team to provide comprehensive care.
* Communicate effectively with families, physicians, and other healthcare providers to ensure coordinated care.
* Monitor and respond to changes in the mother or baby's condition and report any concerns to the appropriate healthcare professionals.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records and documentation.

**Requirements:**

* Valid Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of New York.
* BSN degree or higher preferred.
* Minimum of 2 years of clinical experience as an RN, preferably in a mother baby unit or similar setting.
* Strong knowledge and understanding of postpartum care, newborn care, and breastfeeding techniques.
* Ability to assess and interpret vital signs, monitor newborn health, and identify potential complications.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to provide emotional support and guidance to new mothers.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize responsibilities in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.
* Basic computer skills and proficiency in electronic health record systems.

Join us in making a positive impact on the lives of new mothers and their babies during this special time. Apply now to become a valuable member of our dedicated Mother Baby Registered Nurse (RN) team in Bronx, NY.

**Working for Seven Healthcare:**

Seven Healthcare is one of the USA's most popular agencies for Mother Baby, RN jobs. Rated ‘Excellent’ on Trustpilot from 1900+ reviews, and with 20 major awards behind us, we take pride in knowing we can find you the best possible rates in a role you can be proud of.

Job Types: Full-time, Travel nursing, Contract

Responsible for coordinating the confirmed supply plan with the manufacturing and OMA master production schedulers and facilitates trade-off decisions based on the confirmed supply plan.

title: Porter
description:
**Overview:**

Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, leasing, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity!

We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused Residential Property Porter to join our vibrant team and contribute to the overall satisfaction and well-being of our residents.

**Essential Functions:**

* Maintain the property’s aesthetic appeal and perform routine tasks on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis, encompassing activities such as vacuuming, cleaning, and meticulously detailing common areas, including hallways, lobbies, and recreation spaces, outdoor grounds and landscaping clean and well-maintained.
* Assist in snow and ice removal during inclement weather and put out / remove rain mats to ensure safe pathways for residents.
* Collect and dispose of trash from common areas and ensure proper recycling procedures are followed.
* Work closely with maintenance staff to address minor repairs, painting, water intrusion cleanup, minor damage and other related service requests.
* Clean out vacant units to prepare for apartment turns.
* Provide excellent customer service to residents, responding to inquiries and addressing concerns in a timely and professional manner, and cover front desk / concierge staff and deliver packages to tenants as necessary.
* Comply with workplace safety and OSHA regulations.
* Must be present on-site and be able to move throughout the building to address building related matters and meet with tenants, staff, vendors and visitors.
* Ability to ascend and descend stairs, as well as positioning oneself in small spaces for building inspections and maintenance repairs and lifting and moving large or heavy objects in excess of 50 pounds.
* Must be comfortable with exposure to varying environmental climates and circumstances.

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or equivalent and / or previous experience in a similar role is preferred.
* Ability to operate and maintain landscaping and maintenance equipment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule to include days, nights, weekends, holidays.

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

**Refuah Health**is a federally qualified health center offering comprehensive care in Rockland and Sullivan Counties. We are over one hundred healthcare professionals strong with three decades experience providing unparalleled patient care. As an FQHC, we specialize in accessible and affordable care for low income and high-risk residents. We believe in the power of people to create great care and we are inviting the best healthcare professionals to build their career with us!


We are seeking experienced clinicians (MDs, Dos, NPs & PAs) to join our Acute Care Team.

title: License Practical Nurse
description:
*Your privacy is important to us. All applications are strictly confidential.*

**Refuah Health**is a federally qualified health center offering comprehensive care in Rockland and Sullivan Counties. We are over one hundred healthcare professionals strong with three decades experience providing unparalleled patient care. As an FQHC, we specialize in accessible and affordable care for low income and high-risk residents. We believe in the power of people to create great care and we are inviting the best healthcare professionals to build their career with us!

**Why Refuah?**

* Join a collegial team of healthcare professionals
* Five modern state of the art facilities
* Flexible schedules for maximum work-life balance
* Financial stability with no billing or overhead responsibility
* New graduates and experienced candidates encouraged to apply

**License Practical Nurse Responsibilities:**


1. Patient Care:

* Collects and documents patient history, vital signs, and other relevant information and reports any abnormalities promptly.
* Assist physicians with examination, diagnostic procedures and treatment.
* Performs diagnostic procedures such as EKG, pulse oximetry reading, growth parameters, hearing/vision tests and other as required and within the scope of practice of a LPN.
* Administers medications within the scope of a LPN.
* Documents appropriately and accurately within the medical records.
* Assists in organizing patient flow to ensure quality patient care and effective time management.
* Reinforces the patient and/or family education regarding health promotion and maintenance as well as prevention of illness and injuries.
* Informs the registered professional nurse of any issues or problems that hinders the delivery of quality care.
* Maintains a safe, clean, and patient oriented environment that is sensitive to cultural diversity.
* Respects each patient's unique individual needs, beliefs, and diversity and incorporates these in the delivery of care.
* Helps and resource to the medical assistant as necessary.


2. Performs functions to assist in meeting operational needs:

* Demonstrates the ability to prioritize and organize work flow.
* Able to perform duties with minimal need for direct supervision.
* Participates in the care and storage of equipment in the area of assignment.
* Assists in the ordering and storage of supplies and equipment.
* Maintains the exam rooms, storage areas, medication room, and utility rooms in clean and organized manner.
* Disinfects and sterilizes instruments, equipment and reusable supplies.


3. Supports the mission, vision, and philosophy and goals of the Department of Nursing and Refuah Health Center.


4. Participates in staff development programs to maintain appropriate knowledge, skills and clinical competence.


5. Demonstrates a compassionate and caring attitude in dealing with patients and families.


6. Demonstrates knowledge of effective communication with members of the health care team and utilizes appropriate lines of communication.


7. Demonstrates knowledge of center and department policies, procedures and guidelines as well as regulatory agency standards relating to patient care.


8. Demonstrates knowledge and supports the Patient Bill of Rights.


9. Protects patient's privacy at all times.


10. Complies with applicable policies and procedures and supports the Compliance Program.


11. Contributes to organization operations by performing other duties as may be required.

**Refuah Benefits:**

* **Competitive Compensation**:Our salaries are in line with fair market value, reflecting your skills and dedication.
* **Our facilities are eligible for NHSC loan repayment and NYS Public Loan Forgiveness to help manage your financial burden.**
* **Comprehensive Benefits:**We provide full benefits, including life, health, dental, and vision coverage, ensuring your well-being.
* **Financial Planning:**Benefit from our 403B plan, ensuring your financial security for the future.
* **Tax Advantages:**Flexible Spending Accounts and Health Reimbursement Cards.
* **Professional Growth:**Support for CME activities and medical licensure ensures you stay at the forefront of your field.
* **Work-Life Balance:**Enjoy generous PTO accruals and up to 13 Paid Holidays.

**Live, Work and Play in Rockland:**

* Situated along the majestic Hudson River
* Easy drive to New York City and airports
* Scenic waterfront villages
* Mountain vistas and parks; hiking and biking trails
* Prestigious schools and universities
* Vibrant health, retail, manufacturing, pharmaceutical and construction industries

**What You Bring to Refuah:**

* Current New York State License as a Registered Nurse (RN) or Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN)
* Hours: Daytime, one evening per week, Fridays and available on weekends
* Skilled in performing medical procedures within scope of practice
* Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with the interdisciplinary team
* Ability to demonstrate compassion and caring in dealing with patients and other employees
* Ability to read, write, understand and speak English in a clear and concise manner
* Physical stamina and manual dexterity to perform a variety of tasks and skills in the area of assignment
* Bilingual Preferred
* Eligible to Work in the US

**Apply Today:**


If you are a dedicated License Practical Nurse looking to make a positive impact, we invite you to apply. Join Refuah in transforming the healthcare experience. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic medical team.

title: Pack Leader
description:
Overview:

We are looking for a team member who is organized, professional, and loves nature and animals. In the role of Pack Leader, you will be responsible for the care of 6-8 dogs at a time. This includes safe transport of the dogs to and from their home, providing water, exercise, and enrichment. If you love dogs and want to learn more about proper socialization and care, this is the position for you.

Daily Tasks Include:

* Picking dogs up on time
* Communicating with parents and team members
* Providing exercise and mental enrichment
* Providing water and ensuring well-being
* Keeping dogs calm and controlled on trails
* Managing a group of 6-8 well behaved dogs on trails
* Using scientifically backed training principles to enforce proper behavior in public
* Cleaning and sanitizing

Training will be provided. Previous experience is recommended but not required. Applicants must be able to walk on uneven terrain in all weather conditions for 60 mins. Applicants should have a car with a back seat and be able to transport dogs daily. This position is 30-40 hours per week, including weekends. Shifts are from 8:30am-4:30pm or 12:30pm-4:30. Applicants must have a valid drivers license and maintain proper insurance and registration for their vehicle.

title: Elementary School Teacher (K-6)
company: Newark Public Schools: George Washington Carver/Bruce St School
description:
Newark Public Schools is where passion meets progress. We want you to discover a rewarding career with us. If the opportunity to make learning limitless excites you then, join our community of educators.

George Washington Carver/Bruce St School is an up and coming Pre-K- 8 Public School in the southward of Newark, NJ. We are looking for impactful, motivated, and goal oriented individuals with a passion for educating students. We need culturally responsive innovative individuals who can influence our students to strive for greatness and make a positive impact on our community.

**QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS**

* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university.
* New Jersey Department of Education Standard Certificate, Certificate of Eligibility (CE), or Certificate of Eligibility with Advance Standing (CEAS) in Elementary Ed.
* Possession of a current and valid teaching certificate in the appropriate Certificate issued by the New Jersey Department of Education.
* Persons with mental or physical disabilities are eligible as long as they can perform the essential functions of the job after reasonable accommodation is made for their known limitations. If the accommodation cannot be made because it would cause the employer undue hardship, such persons may not be eligible.
* Ability to read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English sufficiently to perform the duties of this position.

**BASIC FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

1. Plans a program of study that meets the individual needs, interests and abilities of students.

2. Evaluates student progress on a regular basis and prepares progress reports.

3. Instructs pupils in citizenship, basic communications skills and other general elements of the course of study common to all teachers, as specified in state law and administrative regulations and procedures of the district.

4. Provides individual, small, and/or large group instruction, whenever appropriate, in order to adapt the curriculum to the needs of pupils with varying intellectual and special abilities.

5. Instructs pupils in proper care and use of textbooks, equipment and materials.

6. Establishes and maintains standards of pupil behavior needed to provide and orderly and productive environment.

7. Selects and requisitions books, instructional materials, equipment, aids, and maintains required inventory records.

8. Develops instructional plans and organizes class time to provide a balanced program of instruction

9. Develops and maintains professional competence through participation in in-service education activities provided by the district and in self-selected professional growth activities.

10. Supervises out-of classroom activities for pupils during the assigned working day, as required.

11. Plans and coordinates the work of aides, teacher assistants, and other paraprofessionals.

12. Identifies pupil’s needs and cooperates with other professional staff members in assessing and helping pupils solve health, attitude, and learning problems.

13. Communicates with parents and pupil personnel staff members on the individual pupil’s progress and development.

14. Maintains attendance accounting and business service as required.

15. Develops and participates in the sponsorship of student activities and faculty committees.

16. Acts as a resource person on an interdepartmental level to relate appropriate aspects of his/her subject area to other subject areas

17. Works to establish and maintain open lines on communication with students and their parents concerning the academic and behavioral progress of all assigned students.

REPORTS TO: PRINCIPAL

title: Preschool Classroom Afternoon Aide
description:
**Job Title:** Preschool Teacher (2 year old classroom)

**Location:** The Mustard Seed Preschool, Brick, NJ 08742

**Schedule:** Part-time, Monday through Thursday, half or full day depending on candidate

**Pay Rate:** $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

**Position Summary:** The Mustard Seed Preschool is seeking a dedicated and passionate Preschool Teacher to join our early childhood education team. The ideal candidate will have a genuine love for young children and God, a creative approach to teaching, and the ability to foster a nurturing and educational environment. This part-time position requires working Monday through Thursday and offers an hourly wage between $18.00 and $20.00.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate and implement age-appropriate educational curriculum and activities that promote physical, social, emotional, and intellectual growth for preschool children based on developmentally appropriate learning standards.
* Create a safe, engaging, and inclusive classroom environment where children feel welcomed and supported.
* Assess the developmental needs of children and tailor activities to meet these needs in both individual and group settings.
* Foster positive relationships with children, families, and colleagues.
* Ensure a healthy classroom environment by maintaining classroom cleanliness and organization.
* Ensure compliance with all licensing regulations and school policies.
* Communicate effectively and frequently with parents regarding their child's progress, both in person and through digital communication through our ProCare app.
* Participate in staff meetings, training sessions, and professional development opportunities to ensure continuous quality improvement.
* Manage classroom behavior in a positive and constructive manner and supervise teacher assistants and classroom volunteers to ensure they are following planned activities, hygiene and safety standards
* Lead by example and collaborate with other teachers and staff to create a cohesive and supportive educational environment.

**Qualifications:**

* CDA credentials, Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Early Childhood Education, Child Development, or a related field preferred. Minimum high school diploma.
* Previous experience working with preschool-aged children as a lead teacher.
* CPR and First Aid certification, or willingness to obtain.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Creative, energetic, and patient with a passion for early childhood education.
* Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
* Commitment to continuous learning and professional development.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage ($18.00 - $20.00 per hour).
* Paid time off and school holidays off.
* Summers off, unless looking for year-round employment.
* Discounted child care options.
* Free professional development opportunities.
* Supportive Christian work environment.

**How to Apply:** Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter to the center director, Courtney Rzeplinski by July 31st, 2024. Please include "Preschool Teacher Application" in the subject line of your email.

The Mustard Seed Preschool is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

**Contact Information:** Courtney Rzeplinski, Director,

The Mustard seed Preschool

714 Herbertsville Road

Brick NJ 08742

stpaulsmustardseedpreschool@gmail.com

732-458-2080

Join our team and make a difference in the lives of young children every day!

title: STEM Instructor
description:
**TITLE: STEM Teacher** 

**PURPOSE OF JOB**: Under the direction of the Executive Director, this position is responsible for teaching TAfterschool Monday - Friday and TechFests on Saturdays . This position is also responsible for collaborating with other STEM Kids NJ STEM teachers in promoting interdisciplinary STEM activities into the company’s core curriculum.

Classes will be during the time frame of 3:00 pm - 5:00 pm on Monday - Friday, with extended hours from 5:00 pm - 6:30 pm and 9:00 am - 12:00 pm on Saturdays, and **you would teach based upon your availability**.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
1. Deliver STEM-oriented instruction through project-based learning methods. Based upon your proficiency, you would be delivering instruction in Computer Science, or Engineering,  
Science, Robotics, or Creative Tech (MakerSpace, AI, AR/VR) to K-12 students.

2. Attends professional development and training related to STEM programs and methodologies, staying abreast of current research.

3. Employs a variety of instructional techniques, instructional media, and performance assessments, which guide the learning process toward curriculum goals and student learning.

4. Uses technology to promote learning, creativity, and collaboration.

5. Organizes, develops, and coordinates special STEM events/activities.

6. Shares STEM events and activities through social media, such as Facebook, Twitter and  
Instagram.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  
Masters in Mathematics and/or Science and/or a STEM preferred or related field. Bachelor of  
Science Degree and/or demonstrated experience in teaching in a classroom environment required.

1. Experience in delivering professional development to teachers.  
2. Evidence of at least three (3) years of exemplary classroom teaching experience - traditional class or informal learning spaces.  
3. Excellent communication skills.  
4. A proven track record in the use of a rich array of instructional methods, the analysis and use of data and technology to improve instruction, and the ability to build professional relationships, solve problems, and plan collaboratively.  
5. Evidence of productive experience with problem-based learning.  
6. Evidence of planning, organization, and time management skills that will bring structure and accountability to the position.  
7. Proven ability to apply computer science, science and/or math content knowledge, formative assessment,and technology integration at a high level.  
8. Deep understanding of student learning theory, brain-based learning, and differentiated instruction.  
9. Deep understanding of NET-S, NGSS, CCSS and PBL.  
10. Proven ability to collaborate with teachers regarding student learning.  
11. Desire to continue learning “what works” in classroom instruction.  
12. Familiarity with culturally relevant and culturally responsive teaching strategies.

**COMPANY INFO: https://stemkidsnyc.org/**

title: Bilingual Customer Care Navigator - East New York, Brooklyn (English/Spanish)
description:
Summary of Position
* Work closely with onsite sales colleagues to identify customers in need of enrollment services and provide post sales customer service follow‐up.
* Interact face‐to‐face with customers, assisting in providing complete resolution of customer concerns including claims, benefit and enrollment inquiries through health plan navigation, health and wellness coaching and community referrals.
* Proactively research Emblem Health member issues utilizing multiple enterprise systems and data to explain and resolve complicated customer service issues, close care gaps, helping complete HRAs, enabling higher retention of members within the neighboring community.
* Help conduct seminars and workshops on premises and will play an important role in class offerings for the department.
* Collaborate with enterprise team members on member retention efforts and special projects within the location including: Care Management and Quality to understand member needs in the community as they relate to gaps in care; and quality efforts to provide effective in person and outreach services within the community.
* Provide post sales customer service follow‐up with Sales colleagues, both onsite and in the field within the region, to follow up on member customer service and care needs.
* Work with ACPNY teams, both co‐located and within the region, to aid in care gap issues, especially as they relate to social needs and customer service follow up.
* Represent EmblemHealth to all visitors to the sites, including internal and external partners, groups and leaders.
* Maintain a primary Neighborhood Care location but also support multiple Neighborhood Care sites within a region.


Principal Accountabilities
* Identify customer needs and help solve customer issues related to health plans, health and wellness and enrollment within regulatory guidelines; providing direct guidance or identifying other EmblemHealth (EH) and community resources to find customer solutions, conduct customer needs assessment, education on condition management.
* Understand and maintain excellent working knowledge of EmblemHealth products, services and technology platforms.
* Document interactions in support of quantitative metrics for the site and department.
* Work with the manager to deliver and organize onsite health seminars and classes, including EH vendor‐led classes.
* Proactively communicate with customers, EmblemHealth departments and community partners the status of any outstanding issues until solved. Effectively describe final resolution to customer.
* Work together with sales team to identify customers in need of enrollment services and post sales customer service follow‐up. Proactively support operational aspects of other internal partners such as AdvantageCare Physicians, product, customer service and quality to help improve customer experience and operations.
* Participate in weekly meetings with manager and team members across sites to discuss customer care issues, improvement opportunities, community offerings, and other site and company priorities.
* Represent EmblemHealth at onsite interactions with community partners and leaders.


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Additional experience/specialized training may be considered in lieu of educational requirements required
* 3 – 5+ years of experience working with customers in customer service, medical or managed care environment required
* Experience in evidence‐based health and lifestyle coaching techniques preferred
* Ability and willingness to attend appropriate training and certification classes required
* Experience communicating directly with customers, assessing needs, and connecting customers with resources required
* Knowledgeable on how to navigate all aspects of medical care and managed care system, and health and wellness required
* Ability to demonstrate excellent service knowledge and hospitality, and optimistic warmth and empathy for the customers’ experience required
* Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal) with all types/levels of audiences required
* Proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, etc.) required
* Technologically savvy, with the ability to quickly learn and navigate different information technology systems required
* Bilingual English Spanish required
* Flexibility to work in different Neighborhood Care sites when needed required

title: Director, Credentialing
description:
Summary:
* Manage the credentialing process for all medical staff providers, in accordance with The Joint Commission, NCQA, and CMS accreditation standards, and Federal and State Laws.
* Responsible for credentialing analysis, quality assurance, planning, client/vendor relationships and continuous improvement of operational performance.
* Accountable to drive, monitor, and enhance oversight of quality, analytics, and auditing of vendor (Cognizant and other) performance to ensure contractual adherence in both operational and compliance SLAs, quality and timeliness standards.
* Oversee validation of vendor performance reporting and daily operations.
* Accountable to drive, monitor, and enhance Credentialing Delegation oversight, including onboarding of delegates and performance management in synchronicity with regulatory and enterprise policies. Implement process initiatives in alignment with regulatory and enterprise requirements as needed. Develop standardized enterprise processes that incorporates regulations and requirements for EmblemHealth’s Family of Companies.
* Lead and participate in system configuration and new product or process initiatives. Serve as a deciding body in all phases. Execute process and policy changes in accordance.

  

  

Responsibilities:
* Analyze and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency of credentialing.
* Conduct on-going program evaluations and audits of data integrity.
* Ensure accurate outcomes and compliant procedures to meet service goals.
* Coordinate with practice management, licensing agencies, insurance carriers, and other appropriate organizations to complete credentialing and re-credentialing applications
* Manage staff including interviewing and selecting qualified candidates, coaching for career development, training, monitor productivity and accuracy, conduct performance evaluations, guidelines and changes, consistent application of HR policies and procedures, and guide staff to confident decision-making.
* Support, participate and contribute to the development and growth of credentialing functions.
* Work with various departments to ensure a smooth transition of providers when on-boarding, for new contracts and during acquisitions.
* Drive and monitor oversight of vendors’ (Cognizant and other) quality performance for each core process of Credentialing and Delegation to meet contractual requirements and align with regulatory mandates and enterprise-wide (EH and CCI) customer experience objectives and overall corporate strategic direction. Validate and trend reported quality performance results through independent reporting and audit-the-auditor reviews.
* Quantify and validate vendor quality performance by conducting and monitoring on-site and transactional audits, policy and procedure verifications, quality program verifications, adhoc reporting and compliance adherence reviews. Monitor regulatory execution and reporting for sanction and exclusion processing and OMT reporting.
* Lead and develop direct reports to continuously conduct on-site and transactional audits, ad-hoc reporting and compliance adherence reviews. Participate and coordinate in regulatory audit response preparation and audit conveyance. Develop and maintain policy and procedure documentation in accordance with current processes.
* Participate in Credentialing/ReCredentialing Committee meetings, ensuring vendor participation and preparation, and converse with Medical Directors as needed. Ensure preparedness for and participate in Monthly Delegation Oversight Committee (DOC) Meeting.
* Identify opportunities for process improvement, systematic enhancements, and standardization of departmental practices across the enterprise of initial and re-credentialing, regulatory compliance and delegated credentialing oversight. Work with all levels of management and staff to implement changes that enhance the customer experience and operational workflow in support of enterprise objectives.
* Lead and participate in internal and external interdepartmental meetings to maintain and expand business process efficiency, issue management and staff education or training.
* Proactively and clearly communicate milestones, status, selling of ideas and proposals. (use Executive Briefing Tool


Requirements:
* BS or BA degree required
* Certified Provider Credentialing Specialist (CPCS) and Certified Professional in Medical Staff Service Management (CPMSM) is preferred
* 10+ years of relevant professional experience in credentialing and 7 years in a leadership capacity required
* 5+ years of experience in Quality Mgmt. & Improvement, Change Management, and Customer Experience preferred
* Track record of successfully managing large, high impact projects preferred
* Ability to lead, develop, mentor, and manage staff to achieve departmental and organization goals and objectives required

* Ability to work with physicians in a collaborative manner required

title: Registered Nurse - PT 30+
description:
**Come join an exciting and innovative company that puts the “care” back in healthcare!**

  

Why do Registered Nurses want to work here? At KabaFusion, we are committed to building a culture of collaboration and teamwork where we put the needs of the patient at the forefront of everything we do. Join us and discover what it means to be part of a mission driven company that is making a difference.

**About Us:**


KabaFusion has a national network of pharmacies and nursing locations, and our mission is to provide exceptional patient care and positive clinical outcomes. Our home infusion nurses play an integral role in this process, working collaboratively with an interdisciplinary team to ensure that prescribed infusion therapies can be safely and effectively administered in the home setting.

**As a Home Infusion Registered Nurse, you will…**

* Make a difference by using your clinical IV experience and personal touch to assist our patients in the comfort of their own home.
* Provide one-on-one patient care and education in accordance with the prescriber’s plan of treatment.
* Build lasting relationships with your patients.

**As a Registered Nurse, you bring:**

* Registered Nurse license in good standing
* Excellent IV start skills
* Current state driver’s license

**Our Benefits:**

* **Flexible schedule**
* **Door-to-door pay**
* Mileage reimbursement (door-to-door)
* Shift differential
* Opportunity to participate in on-call program for additional compensation
* Reimbursement for certifications/ongoing certification renewal
* Free CEUs and reimbursement for approved CEUs
* **Benefits start on your 1st day of employment**
* **401k w 4% match – no waiting or vesting period**
* PTO / Floating Holiday / Paid Holidays
* Company paid life insurance, STD
* Employee Assistance programs to help with mental health / wellness
* Learning & Development Programs
* Perks… includes discounts on travel, cell phone, clothing and more…
* Generous employee referral program

**All of our Registered Nurses have iPads and document electronically in our myKabaFusion app.**

 **KabaFusion is a mission driven company with a focus on innovation and patient care so, as a Registered Nurse, if that sounds like something you want to be a part of, then look no further.**
company_description: KabaFusion is a national home infusion therapy company specializing in the administration of IVIG, SCIG, and Acute therapies along with nutritional products in the comfort of the patient’s home.

title: Associate Medical Director, Medical Affairs
description:
Pharmacosmos Therapeutics Inc., an affiliate of Pharmacosmos, markets Monoferric in the US high-dose IV iron market. Pharmacosmos Therapeutics brings together:

* A best-in-class product
* Resources required to drive rapid growth
* An ability to adapt quickly to market change
* A new standard for patient care


Founded in 1965, Pharmacosmos is headquartered in Denmark. We are a family-held company built on passionate and knowledgeable people. We value integrity, open-mindedness, and respect. These values guide us in our endeavors and touch everyone in every part of our journey. We respect everyone who becomes a part of our journey. As a company, we strive to become the world leader in the treatment of iron deficiency anemia, one of the largest global health issues, and aspire to change the way iron deficiency anemia is treated.

  

Pharmacosmos is focused on three business areas: branded pharmaceuticals, APIs, and carbohydrates. The US company focuses primarily on the prescription iron pharmaceutical market. Two-thirds of its revenue comes from this segment of the business. Pharmaceutical grade carbohydrates and API enhance their supply chain capabilities and overall market strategy and positioning. The company takes pride in our robust research and development program with a focus on human and veterinary medicines.

  

Pharmacosmos cultivates a collaborative, performance-based culture. We recognize and reward employees for the value they bring and empower them to do meaningful work. Built upon the heritage and financial strength of the parent company, Pharmacosmos Therapeutics benefits from a singular focus, driving the growth of Monoferric.

**Job purpose:**
================


The primary responsibility of the Associate Medical Director (AMD) is to support the implementation of the national medical affairs strategy for development of the assigned therapeutic areas. AMD assumes therapeutic area leadership, provides strategic input into Phase IV studies, works closely with key opinion leaders, takes an active role in data generation, implements publication plans and supports the commercial teams. The AMD works to shape patient care through Pharmacosmos’ medicines, research and customer services excellence.

**Duties and responsibilities:**
================================


Within the assigned therapeutic area(s), the AMD is expected to:

* Support medical strategy and execution of assigned therapeutic areas
* Serve as the subject matter expert and provide guidance to medical and commercial teams
* Identify areas of development, input into medical plans and execute medical affairs strategy by taking actions that lead to advances ensuring optimal patient treatment.
* Support gap analyses to identify and optimize future indication and utilization potential of our products.
* Provide education and training of both field commercial and field medical teams as needed
* Support the marketing team from a clinical perspective as they develop promotional campaigns.
* Support Scientific Communications and RWE with data generation and publication plan, including authorship.
* Taylor downstream scientific communication plans to medically segmented audiences
* Lead the utilization of the thought leader pool to support medical affairs initiatives.
* Develop and roll-out educational concepts focusing on PTI’s therapeutic area(s) awareness and screening, guideline recommendation and therapies.
* Support field medical insight analyses and communication.
* Provide scientific support for the development of materials by Medical, Marketing, and/or Market Access and ensure alignment against Medical strategies.
* Establish and maintain strong professional relationships with key external stakeholders, such as


professional societies, patient organizations and relevant institutions.

* Support strategy and tactics for assigned National Accounts.
* Support the medical affairs congress strategies.
* Oversee the strategy and execution of medical advisory boards.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Education & Professional Background:**
========================================

* Advanced degree in life sciences (MD, DO, PharmD, NP with hematology clinical experience preferred).
* 1-3 years of Medical Affairs experience within the pharmaceutical industry preferred,
* Working knowledge of the clinical development process and the ICH-GCP guidelines.

**Competencies:**
=================

* Leadership – ethical, ambitious, focused, organized
* Customer-oriented – analyze and meet/exceed customers’ needs
* Excellent communication skills – verbal and written
* Responsible – timely and explicit feed-back to customers on agreements
* Transparency – flat decision structure and communication
* Accountability – Independent decision-making (impartiality, competence, and ethics)
* Ability to act locally, also in accordance with main priorities of the company

**Attitude and Behavior:**
==========================

* Proud Pharmacosmos ambassador
* Strong personal leadership
* Inspire cross-functional transparency and collaboration
* Customer-centric ‘can-do’ attitude and goal focused
* Ambitious, independent, analytical, collaborative, loyal, organized.

**Flexibility**
===============


Our roles can evolve over time. Reasonable flexibility is, therefore, a key part of any job at Pharmacosmos. Significant variations in duties and responsibilities should be discussed between the employee and the manager.

**Additional information**
==========================

* Requires discretion with confidential data
* Travelling – approximately 30% of the time. Overnight stays – on average 3-4 nights per month

 *All job requirements listed indicate the minimum level of knowledge, skills and/or experience necessary to perform the job proficiently. This job description is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties as requested by their supervisor, subject to reasonable accommodation.*

*Pharmacosmos Therapeutics Inc. is committed to equal opportunity in employment. We value diversity which embraces all perspectives towards innovation and are committed to making PTI a truly inclusive place to work where everyone of us can be our best and true selves.*

*We select and employ qualified candidates in accordance with their competencies and skills to perform the duties of the job regardless of gender, gender identity or expression, ancestry, national or ethnic origin, marital status, race, religion, color, age, disability, sexual orientation, military, or veteran status.*

*Pharmacosmos Therapeutics Inc. has adopted a hybrid work schedule – a combination of being on-site at our Morristown, NJ offices along with remote working. Being present is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement and enhances the Company culture.*

  

#LI-Hybrid

title: Salesforce Data Cloud Architect
description:
### **Role description**


Work Location: Union Beach, NJ.



Mode of work: Hybrid (Tue-Thu)



Role: Salesforce Data Cloud Architect



Responsibilities :


Responsible for matching business process and automation requirements to the capabilities of SFDC, including data model, role hierarchy, sharing and security model


Provide functional architecture strategy and guidance for all SFDC rollouts, Design-for-adoption strategy


Designing the overall data architecture, using Salesforce Data Cloud as the central repository to support Customer 360 Data Manager, ensuring all customer data is consolidated and actionable.



Reviews functional design for initiatives and lead defining dev standards and best practices



Conduct research into clients’ use of Salesforce, producing a report of findings with recommended steps and a roadmap for Salesforce solutions.



Lead and advise customers on best practices around data cleansing and transforming raw data using Data workflow leveraging on-platform and off-platform tools, mapping data elements to relevant business representation and partitioning them into the right spaces for business groups to consume in campaigns, automation, and analytics



Develop integration strategies to unify disparate data systems, such as sales, customer service, and marketing, to create a single source of truth across the organization.



Collaborating with data stewards and architects to ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity within the Data Cloud platform.



Implementing AI-powered insights within Salesforce Data Cloud, enabling the organization to utilize artificial intelligence using Salesforce native models for predictive analytics, trend spotting, and decision support.



Ensuring real-time data processing is established, allowing for the immediate updating and availability of data across systems, thereby facilitating timely and informed business decisions.



Customizing data security frameworks to safeguard sensitive information, and setting up rules, and permissions to maintain data integrity and compliance.



Empowering data-driven decision-making by providing stakeholders with access to comprehensive analytics and insights from integrated data sources.



Streamlining operational efficiency through the automation of data-related workflows and the optimization of data access for various business units.



Preparing the organization for AI-readiness by establishing data collection and management practices that will serve as the foundation for future AI applications and innovations.



Designing and refining data ingestion strategies to capture and funnel data into the Data Cloud from a multitude of sources, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.



Developing and applying data transformation logic and formulas to cleanse, restructure, and enrich raw data into meaningful formats.



Creating and managing robust data models that align with the organization’s analytics needs, including the development of custom Data Model Objects (DMOs) when the standard Customer 360 models require augmentation.



Devising mapping strategies for Data Lake Objects (DLOs) to DMOs, ensuring that data flows logically and efficiently within the system.



Establishing best practices for data governance, stewardship, and architecture within the Data Cloud environment to maintain high data quality and compliance standards.



Providing technical leadership in the selection and application of data management tools within the Data Cloud, facilitating the integration of third-party data and leveraging Salesforce’s suite of tools for maximum impact.


### **Skills**


Salesforce-Architecture, Salesforce Dataclou


### **Other details**


Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with LTIMindtree (“LTIM”):



Benefits and Perks:


* Comprehensive Medical Plan Covering Medical, Dental, Vision
* Short Term and Long-Term Disability Coverage
* 401(k) Plan with Company match
* Life Insurance
* Vacation Time, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays
* Paid Paternity and Maternity Leave

title: Risk Operations Analyst
description:
Tradeweb is seeking a Risk Operations Analyst to join our Risk team. The successful candidate will assist with Tradeweb’s Client Due Diligence and Vendor Risk Management Programs. This position will be responsible for working closely with clients to respond to their due diligence requests as well as conduct ongoing monitoring and risk assessments of vendors. Additional responsibilities will include assistance with the ongoing review and maintenance of Tradeweb’s Policy Documents and Business Continuity Planning. This position will involve working directly with all internal business units, corporate functions and technology on a regular basis.

  

**Job Responsibilities**

  

* Receive, Coordinate, Manage, Track, Store, and Respond to incoming client due diligence information requests
* Assist with risk assessments on prospective and existing vendors in accordance with the firm’s Third Party and Vendor Risk Management policy and procedures
* Interface with key stakeholders across the organization to respond to client due diligence reviews and vendor risk assessments
* Assist in the management and testing of regional BCP and DR plans
* Assist with the review and maintenance process for the Policy Management Program
* Leverage existing tools and processes to execute job responsibilities
* Develop and enhance reporting with regards to areas of responsibility
* Proactively identify improvement opportunities across areas of responsibility

**Qualifications**


* 1-2 years of experience in an operations role or working in the banking, consulting, financial services, Fintech industry, or applicable industry.
* BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, English or relevant degree
* Ability to quickly develop an understanding of business processes and technology used within Tradeweb across all businesses
* Confident ability to drive tasks through to completion
* Ability to manage competing deadlines and prioritize responsibilities to effectively meet business needs
* Attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, the ability to multi-task and set priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Work both independently and as part of a team at all levels and across all business units
* Experience collaborating with other cross-functional teams, such as Cyber Risk, Information Security, Compliance and others
* Experience with Microsoft PowerPoint/Excel, reporting tools, Confluence, SharePoint and Asana are highly desired
* Experience with GRC tools are preferred
* Experience in risk management and/or conducting due diligence reviews is preferred

**Additional Information**


Tradeweb is committed to providing valuable and competitive benefits. In addition to working in our culture of innovation and collaboration, we offer:


* **Health Insurance**: Highly competitive medical, dental, and vision programs
* **Hybrid Environment**: Our employees have the flexibility of working in the office and from home.
* **Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts**: You may elect to set aside pre-tax earnings to pay for eligible health care and dependent day care expenses for you and your eligible family members.
* **Maven Family Building Benefit**: Maven offers support for fertility and preconception; pregnancy and post-partum; adoption; surrogacy and paediatrics for children up to age 10. Tradeweb provide a $10,000 lifetime reimbursement towards fertility, egg freezing, adoption and surrogacy expenses.
* **Building Wealth - 401(k) Savings Plan**: Employees are immediately eligible for the 401(k) plan. Participants may contribute up to 75% of eligible compensation into a traditional 401(k) and/or Roth 401(k). Tradeweb will match 100% of the first 4% of compensation that you contribute.
* The current pay range for this role if performed in the city of New York is currently $65,000 to $100,000 per year, based on a regular, full-time schedule. The amount of pay offered will be determined by a number of factors, including but not limited to qualifications, market data, geographic location, and internal guidelines.

**Other Benefit Programs**


* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Program
* ARAG Legal Services
* Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Financial Wellness Tools
* Travel Assistance Benefits
* Pet Insurance
* Corporate Gym Subsidies
* Wellness Perks
* Paid Time Off and Parental Leave

  

**Company Description**


Tradeweb Markets is a world leader in the evolution of electronic trading. A fintech company serving approximately 2,500 clients – including the world’s largest banks, asset managers, hedge funds, insurance companies, wealth managers and retail clients - in more than 65 countries across the globe. Since our first trade in 1998, we have helped transform and electronify the fixed income markets. Tradeweb is a culture built on innovation, creativity and collaboration. Through a combination of very talented and driven people, innovative products and solutions, cutting-edge technology, market data, and a vast network of clients, we continue to work together to improve the way financial markets trade.

  

Mission: Move first and never stop. Collaborate with clients to create and build solutions that drive efficiency, connectivity, and transparency in electronic trading.

  

Tradeweb Markets LLC ("Tradeweb") is proud to be an EEO Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Handyperson
description:
**Overview:**

Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, leasing, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity!

We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused Residential Property Handyman to join our vibrant team and contribute to the overall maintenance, satisfaction and well-being of our residents. The ideal candidate will be proficient in a variety of repair and maintenance tasks, contributing to the overall well-being of the property and ensuring a safe and comfortable environment for residents.

**Essential Functions:**

* Perform routine maintenance and repairs on residential units, including plumbing, electrical, HVAC, appliance repair, and carpentry tasks.
* Address minor HVAC issues, Inspect, troubleshoot, and repair household appliances to ensure functionality and safety and collaborate with specialized technicians for major repairs. Coordinate with vendors for appliance replacements when necessary.
* Paint and complete drywall repairs to maintain a fresh and appealing appearance throughout the property.
* Repair and replace flooring materials as needed, ensuring a safe and aesthetically pleasing environment.
* Perform routine maintenance on units in preparation of apartment turns, and maintain maintenance shop, including related inventory of supplies.
* Conduct regular safety inspections, identifying and addressing potential hazards promptly.
* Be available for on-call duties and respond to emergency maintenance requests outside regular working hours.
* Comply with workplace safety and OSHA regulations.

title: General Manager (GM)
description:
RESTAURANT GENERAL MANAGER @ MOCHA LUX Union Square

Welcome to the JUNGLE! A Wynwood meets Tulum Experience!

Explore Career Opportunities at Mocha Hospitality Group  
Come grow your career with MHG! One of the many reasons MHG is unlike other restaurant companies, is because most of our leaders are promoted from within.

The Mocha Hospitality group operates competitively excellent restaurants, steakhouse and bars. Our business is founded on a simple idea: offer each customer the best possible service, quality, value and selection. We are looking for talented restaurant staff to contribute top tier performances in the food and beverage arena. Our operations are fast paced, high quality and customer service focused.

We are dedicated to hiring outstanding individuals who share our passion for serving customers and preparing quality food and beverages. Our people and their commitment to customer service are what set us apart. We believe in empowering you to make great decisions and to take care of your customers and career. The opportunities are endless.

Positions looking to fill immediately.

General Manager

MHG Restaurant Group is a collection of boutique restaurants, searching for talented individuals who want to help build a legacy one great restaurant at a time.

Our first restaurant concept, Mocha Bleu, opened in 2009 with a modest 35 table space in the West Inglewood area of Teaneck, NJ. Mocha Bleu was a pioneer in upscale French, Italian cuisine with a focus on serving families the highest quality ingredients with warm, respectful service. The result? People lined up out the door daily, and a French, Italian Kosher restaurant legend was born.

Following a passion for creating innovative dining concepts, MHG Restaurant Group opened its second food sensation, Mocha Burger, and then a fine dining restaurant named Mocha Red.

From our humble beginning of one restaurant with a handful of employees to multiple brands and OVER 100 team members today, we welcome you to explore career opportunities at MHG.

**Our Mission**  
To “wow” our guests through extraordinary service, fresh quality food, in an inviting environment.  
**Our Vision**  
Grow the company to create even more career opportunities.  
**Our Culture**  
*A Culture of Familia and Respect*

· Respect Each Other  
· Respect the Guest  
· Respect the Food  
· Respect the Company  
· Respect Yourself

**Pay & Benefits**  
We offer competitive salaries, annual bonuses and a full range of benefits – because we believe our leaders deserve to be rewarded, in more ways than one. A Choice on Medical, **Dental and Vision** Insurance Plans, Paid Vacation and Personal Days. Optional Supplemental Programs, Pet Insurance, Wellness Program, Employee Assistance Program, Generous Dining Discounts at Company Owned Restaurants, Training and Career Development, Annual Convention Conference.

Diversity feeds our MHG Familia. Our commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and experience has made us known to be valuable members of the communities our boutique restaurants are part of.  
MHG Restaurant Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
