title: Fitness Sales Associate
description:
StretchLab Tribeca is currently seeking a high energy, passion filled and sales motivated individual that is fitness minded and has a love for community and our brand!

Founded in 2015 in Venice, California, StretchLab is the industry leader in offering one-on-one assisted stretching. With Co-Founders coming from the Personal Training industry, StretchLab has created a variety of offerings to empower clients to ‘Live Long’. StretchLab has gathered a team of experts already certified in an array of related fields – physical therapy, chiropractic medicine, yoga, Pilates, and more – and brought in the world’s leading authority on stretching and flexibility to deliver on the promise of having the finest team of stretching professionals gathered anywhere. StretchLab’s proprietary flexologist ™ training ensures that their client’s receive a world class stretching session.

**POSITION:**

The purpose of the Sales Associate is to assist the General Manager with new membership sales by bringing new members to the studio and booking them into Intro Classes. The Sales Associate also assists with retaining current members. Fitness knowledge or background is preferred but not required.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

● Excellent sales, communication, and customer service skills required

● Goal-oriented with an ability to achieve sales in memberships for one-on-one and group assisted stretch and retail

● Ability to learn and use the Club Ready software system

● Ability to stand or sit for up to 8 hours throughout the workday

● Must be fluent in English and have excellent communication skills via in person, phone and email

● Must be able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines

● Must have proficient computer skills

● Daily and/or occasional travel may be required.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

● Assist the General Manager with the sales process of lead generation, follow up, and close

● Book and confirm intro classes

● Manage the front desk to greet and check-in clients and prospects when they enter the studio

● Conduct tours of the facility while establishing a relationship and targeting individual’s needs and wants

● Maintain acceptable level of personal sales production

● Emphasize and enforce objectives of the club as a fitness and wellness provider

● Present available services to current or prospective members

● Book quality appointments to achieve monthly sales quota and follow-up with leads and missed intro classes

● Participate in special events (health fairs, grand openings, marathons, and community and hospital events) to promote the club

● Ensure studio is clean and tidy

● Other duties as assigned

**COMPENSATION & PERKS:**

● Competitive compensation based on experience

● Free or discounted memberships

● Opportunity for bonus based on performance.

● Huge opportunities for growth within the studios, including additional sales and management opportunities

The Bernic Hotel is a comfortably chic 96 room luxury boutique hotel located in Midtown East Manhattan in the Turtle Bay area. title: Maintenance Manager
description:
Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, leasing, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity!

Join us as a visionary Maintenance Manager, leading the charge in the dynamic world of multifamily apartments! You will manage and coordinate daily operations, oversee and review staff performance, and contribute to the financial success of the property. We're on the lookout for a trailblazer with exceptional leadership and problem-solving skills, and the ability to multitask like a pro. As the leader of the assigned community, you'll ensure compliance, optimize building performance, and enhance resident satisfaction. Ready for an exhilarating challenge? Your adventure begins here!

**Key Responsibilities**

* Manage day-to-day property operations & maintenance of asset with a focus on promptly addressing tenant and client concerns.
* Ensure the timely maintenance of all building operations and systems, including coordinating preventive maintenance work, readiness of mechanical equipment, and performance of asset.
* Ensure that all properties successfully pass audits and company, city and state inspections, and remain compliant with local laws and national code.
* Oversee all maintenance and repair activities, which involves obtaining quotes from vendors, scheduling and coordinating work, and reviewing completed tasks.
* Ability to review corporate standard operating procedures for maintenance and implement program.
* Collaborate with external contractors and vendors for specialized services.
* Negotiate service contracts, from the bidding process to management of building contracts, and verifying that suppliers/service providers meet their contractual obligations (e.g., HVAC, cleaning, landscaping, snow removal, pest control, critical systems maintenance, etc.).
* Ensure that all work performed by external parties meets quality and safety standards.
* Assist in the development and management of the building maintenance budget.
* Routinely review budget variances and communicate with community manager to meet financial goals of the property.
* Monitor and control maintenance expenditures to meet budget goals and identify cost savings, if possible, without compromising the quality of work.
* Respond to building emergencies by coordinating resources and providing guidance to resolve the situation and implement corrective and preventive actions.
* Supervise construction projects and capital improvements as needed.
* Enforce safety protocols and guidelines for all maintenance activities.
* Conduct regular safety inspections and provide necessary training to ensure a safe work environment.
* Investigate and report any workplace accidents or incidents.
* Maintain accurate records of all maintenance activities, repairs, and inspections.
* Prepare reports and documentation for management as needed.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory and legal requirements.
* Recruit, hire, lead, train, mentor and evaluate a team of building staff.
* Administer disciplinary actions for all building staff.
* Create and maintain a productive working environment by assigning and following up on daily tasks.
* Approve weekly payroll and oversee all personnel actions.
* Must be able to reside on site.
* Able to remain stationary for extended periods of time, up to 50% of the work day.
* Ability to move about the building(s) for meetings with tenants, vendors and staff.
* Ascend / descend stairs and ladders, as well as positions oneself in small spaces for building inspections and maintenance.
* Effectively communicate with tenants, vendors, staff and various departments within the company.
* Recognize areas for improvement, detect issues and assess the best plan of action to rectify them.
* Transport large or heavy objects (up to 50 lbs) throughout the property.
* Exposure to a variety of environments to include varying weather conditions.

**Qualifications**

* A minimum of 4 years of experience in maintenance and staff management.
* Ability to implement sustainable energy practices to optimize building efficiency.
* Experience with grid interactive maintenance procedures to reduce carbon footprint of building.
* Demonstrated knowledge of building mechanical systems, including but not limited to plumbing, electrical, carpentry, apartment alterations, waterproofing, and HVAC.
* Proficiency in effective verbal and written communication with staff, property management teams, and senior management.
* Possession of the required licenses and certificates (EPA 608 Universal).
* Willingness to respond to emergencies and be on call 24 hours.
* Strong self-management and prioritization skills.
* Maintain professional demeanor at all times.
* Practical experience with modern motion detection and video capture technologies to reduce costs and enhance security.
* Proficiency with computers and property management software, including Microsoft Office and Yardi.

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

title: Operations Coordinator
description:
**SUMMARY:** The Logistics Coordinator’s main responsibility is to support the seamless operation of the company’s services by receiving and processing export / import client’s shipments via truck, airline, and steamship companies. Responsible for executing all functions related to the successful operation of this position and to provide top notch customer service with continual improvement in mind. **DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:****Export:*** Communicate with carriers, overseas agents, and customers via telephone and email. Take booking requests and export customer service calls.
* Ensure he/she has current buying/selling rates set-up for every export shipment.
* Complete proper export documentation and send pre-alerts. Request documents from shipper as required.
* Check the shipments in the warehouse as needed to ensure that the shipping documents are appropriate for each shipment.
* Review and understand standard operation procedures to ensure compliance with all regulations, TSA, ISO, IMDG and Export Control including AES/EEI.
* Notify customers of any delays regarding arrival or delivery of their cargo.
* Responsible for special shipments involving perishables and/or be in-charge of special accounts.
* Close out files in a timely manner according to company standards.
* Dispatch driver to customers to pick up freight and monitor its arrival for consolidation.
* Handle accounting processes accurately and in a timely manner as they apply to the operations department.
* May require driving company van, forklift, and use of scales.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Cross Train as time permits

**Import:*** Track customer calls for loading instructions. Consult and respond to client requests in a timely manner via e-mail or telephone.
* Contact agents at the point of origin to obtain information on the cargo to be imported. Identify type of goods and modality to be used for transportation.
* Obtain cargo information and Incoterms from customer.
* Ensure cargo arrival with the required documents from country of destination. Contact agents in the country of origin to ensure that the necessary documents are sent.
* Give instruction and/or direction to warehouse personnel as necessary
* Coordinate with airlines and customs the arrival of goods, notifying the customer at the appropriate time.
* Send arrival notice with all necessary information for cargo clearance. Notify and send documentation to broker for the process of cargo clearance.
* Receive broker notification of the cargo that has been released.
* Coordinate cargo pick-up with airline and driver.
* Coordinate, request and where appropriate, make payment of import fees.
* Coordinate and secure receipt of goods in the warehouse.
* Notify customers about cargo status.
* Coordinate cargo clearance from warehouse to customer; Coordinate deconsolidation.
* Notify warehouse about cargo receiving documentation.
* Confirm shipment to ISF customs 10+2/10+5 for the US as required.
* Confirm with sending agent the shipment of AMS/ACE to the US Customs System
* Identify import trading terms (DDP, DDU, DAI).
* Be point of contact with Prime Fresh Handling customers and complaints with agents.
* Monitor monthly customer satisfaction.
* Organize, make, and monitor claim process, of any loss, damage, or delay in cargo.
* Provide direction to warehouse personnel as necessary and may review warehouse personnel’s work product to ensure it supports optimum customer service.
* Any other duty that management requests to fulfill company’s main objectives.

Performs other tasks/duties as assigned by immediate supervisor or management.  
* 
* **QUALIFICATIONS:**
* 2 + Years of experience in the operation of air and sea import/export and its relevant documentation.
* Ability to work extended hours and respond to calls / e-mails outside of business hours.
* Excellent customer service.
* Ability to work independently.
* High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
* Computer skills required: Microsoft Office; SAP Magaya.
* Bilingual: English/Spanish

title: Assistant Director Jobs-Plus
description:
**Urban Upbound** 

**Jobs-Plus Assistant Director**

**Background:**

Founded in 2004, the mission of Urban Upbound is to provide residents of public housing neighborhoods the tools and resources needed to achieve economic mobility and self-sufficiency, and to break cycles of poverty.

Urban Upbound advances its mission through five integrated programs: employment services, financial counseling, youth development/college and career access, the Urban Upbound Federal Credit Union, and community revitalization services.

Jobs-Plus is a proven place-based employment program designed to increase the earnings and employment of working age public housing residents. Jobs-Plus uses a three pronged approach which includes: employment-related services; financial incentives that make work pay; and community supports for work, the strengthening of social ties among residents and community stakeholders to support residents’ job preparation and work efforts.

**Position Description:**

Reporting to the Program Director, the Assistant Director is a key member of the Jobs-Plus team to ensure that the program is on track to meet and exceed all stated outcomes including membership, job placement, retention, financial, and educational milestones, while serving residents of public housing with high quality programming. Responsibilities include:

* Assisting the Program Director on all contractual matters and ensuring program goals relating to the Jobs-Plus Initiative are met;
* Ensuring daily operations run smoothly through management of program and front-line staff; fostering positive and collaborative relationships with staff and provide group and one-on-one support and guidance to staff members
* Evaluating the Jobs-Plus Initiative quantitatively and qualitatively and developing modifications based on emerging needs. Creating reports, as requested, for approval of Program Director and Data & Evaluation Manager;
* Developing a strong relationship with existing community stakeholders including residents, Residents’ Association, NYCHA services and Management, businesses and other community-based organizations;
* Assisting Program Director in building “Community Support for Work” in the development, a framework that encourages peer-to-peer networking and information sharing throughout job search, attainment, and career advancement;
* Proactively problem solve and discuss potential solutions and improvements with the Program Director;
* Planning and executing special events such as job fairs, conferences, evening workshops, lobby sessions, and town hall meetings;
* Assist Program Director in meeting funder requests and represent Urban Upbound at funder and partner meetings; and
* Performing additional duties as assigned by program and Urban Upbound leadership.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s Degree in Social Work or Counseling strongly preferred.
* Minimum of 2 years supervisory experience.
* Successful implementation of a similar program, providing comprehensive assessment and case management services to a large caseload, preferably on a performance-based project.
* Comprehensive understanding of contract management and ability to engage in long-term planning with guidance for the Program Director.
* Passion for working to improve the lives of public housing residents through workforce development, education, community organization, and related social policies.
* Ability to multitask, work well as part of a team, and maintain positive relationships with staff, Urban Upbound management and other key stakeholders.
* Written and verbal communication skills that are clear, concise, and applicable for all audiences. Sense of humor is a must.
* Eagerness for continued learning and development.
* Willingness to take initiative and complete tasks without prompting.
* Background in workforce development is a plus.
* Bilingual Spanish and English strongly preferred.
* Must be able to work some evenings and Saturdays.

Additionally, the Assistant Director will participate in and successfully complete the 45 hour financial counselor training that was developed by the NYC Office of Financial Empowerment in conjunction with CUNY.

title: Warehouse Inventory Supervisor
description:
**Title:** Inventory Supervisor

**Reports To:** Director Of Warehouse Operations

**Location:** New Brunswick, New Jersey

**Salary:** $45,000 - $55,000 annually based on experience.

**Shift:** Hourly, Monday through Friday, 7:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., with 2 - 15-minute breaks at 10 a.m. and 2 p.m. and a 30-minute lunch break at noon.

**Role Description**


Cenmed Enterprises owns a 15,000 sq. ft. warehouse with six additional garages of inventory. We seek an individual contributor with experience working in a 20,000 - 40,000 sq. ft. warehouse or distribution center and previous inventory management experience & responsibilities interested in owning an organization's warehouse inventory processes and procedures.


This is an excellent opportunity to join a premier medical and laboratory supply company at its headquarters in New Brunswick. The Inventory Control Supervisor will maintain the integrity of Cenmed's inventory counts and reconcile inventory variances, expiry tracking, return tracking, and short/over picks with accountability for managing 1 - 2 additional employees.

**What You'll Do**

* Coordinate the implementation of inventory control procedures for bulk inventory and raw materials.
* Develop and standardize processes to improve inventory accuracy and minimize inventory shrinkage.
* Oversee inventory audits to ensure alignment with quarterly targets.
* Develop processes incorporating inventory consolidation and replenishment functions to optimize locations and increase warehouse capacity.
* Overhaul Cenmed existing inventory structure.
* Complete weekly cycle counts.
* Executes bi-monthly inventory analysis; identifies and resolves discrepancies.
* Coordinates with warehouse associates on inventory verification during the picking process.
* Monitor inventory accuracy and integrity, conduct regular cycle and spot counts, and promptly address discrepancies or issues.
* Accurately records any adjustments in the ERP system and keeps a record.
* Manages cycle counting process and expiry tracking.
* Leads entire inventory at the corporate location semi-annually.
* Manage the put-away of inventory from the receiving team.
* Manage the entire return process for all Cenmed clients.


**What You'll Bring to The Table**

* 3-5 years of inventory control experience in wholesale/retail distribution or equivalent.
* Understanding of warehousing and inventory management processes.
* Ability to read and understand shipping documents.
* Excellent number skills and analytical mindset.
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel.
* Excellent communicator, both written and verbal.
* Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.

 **Perks & Benefits**

  

* Medical, Dental, Vision & Basic Life Insurance
* 401K with company match
* A variety of voluntary benefits, such as short-term disability
* Competitive Salary, Performance Bonus
* Flexible Time Off Program
* Referral Bonus Program
* Fun Culture

  

We recognize that people bring a wealth of experience and talent beyond the technical requirements of a job. You should apply if your experience is similar to what is listed here. Diversity of knowledge and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.

title: Assitant Client Services / Client Onboarding / Client Support
description:
MetaBrand is a profitable, rapidly growing, and expanding manufacturing company located in Edison, NJ. More specifically, our space in the market is as a beverage development company that creates and produces sports drinks, natural beverages along with alcohol-based canned cocktails, CBD-infused drinks, and other emerging beverages.

**Compensation:**

We believe compensation is should be determined by experience, knowledge, performance, and the positive impacts that valuable employees bring to and organization. While we post a starting number, we take all the factors into consideration when presenting offers to prospective employees.

**Please note this is not an entry level position.** 

We are looking for individuals to assist with "onboarding" new Clients into our Product Development & Manufacture Service areas. Applicants must have previous:

* Post Sales support to oboard clients into an organization
* Ongoing Client Management & Support experience
* Customer "Account" Management.

Ideally, applicants will have prior experience onboarding and supporting new customers in **Technology,** **Manufacturing**, **Communications**, and **Insurance companies**.

This role is involved with every stage of the customer sales cycle, onboarding, and daily delivery of services. This position requires continuous interactions with our clients that includes phone, email, and text communications. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who thrives in growing their skill sets, knowledge, and looks at challenges as an opportunity, not an obstacle. As we continue to grow, our expectation is to advance the candidate into a group manager, or area manager position.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Active client onboarding process for new clients
* Participate in client sales cycles to understand the client's needs and implementation requirements.
* Utilize NetSuite MRP & ERP platform modules and process.
* MS Excel / Office at a high proficiency level.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for the company's clients at all levels (onboarding, planning, POC, materials planning, etc.)
* Assist in sourcing materials, coordinating inbound & outbound shipments of materials and finished goods.
* Assist in the creation of production schedules, production documentation, and QA/QC documentation for production.
* Monitor client raw materials and other inventories.

**Abilities and Skills** 

* Excellent communication skills with customers, suppliers, and vendors.
* "Can Do" person that is solution oriented.
* Outstanding Multi-tasking skills and prioritization skills.
* Demonstrated attention to detail.
* Ability to manage details, tasks, to-do's, along with timelines and deadlines.
* Reliability, dependability & active client communications.
* Knowledgeable with Office 365 & Teams infrastructure.
* Experience with Netsuite ERM/MRP is preferred.

Preference will be given to candidates with existing manufacturing Client Management experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

* Sales Support: 1 year (Required)
* Client Managment: 1 year (Required)
* Microsoft Office 365: 3 years (Required)

title: WINTER: Shuttle Driver
description:
**Season:****Seasonal Winter Dec 2024 – March 2025** **Position Purpose:**


Shuttle drivers operate the shuttle to transport employees and participants around campus and report any vehicle issues in the appropriate logbook. **Qualifications:**

* Must be 21 years of age or older.
* Required to possess a valid/unexpired driver's license
* Current CDL with a P and S endorsement (Preferred)

 **Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:*** Must be punctual, reliable, able to follow instructions and work as part of a team.

**Responsibilities:**

* Operate a 12 passenger Sprinter in a safe manner to transport employees and guests around the center property as well as offsite parking areas, airports, and occasional remote destinations.
* Responsible for keeping accurate vehicle logs and reporting vehicle issues such as fuel and repair needs.
* Ability to effectively communicate with guest relations personnel and base station.
* Must provide excellent customer service and interact in a courteous manner with employees and guests.

**Work Environment & Physical Demands:*** Sitting for long periods of time.
* Ability to function effectively in extreme weather conditions and in other inclement weather conditions.
* Must be able to work various shifts, including nights and weekends.
* Willingness to work irregular hours delivering program in the facility available.

  

Note: This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications associated with this job. . While performing the duties of this job, the employee will frequently be exposed to outside weather conditions. The employee may encounter extreme winter cold and blizzard conditions.**Company Mission**

**Winter4Kids**exists to create healthy lifestyles and influence behaviors of youth through winter activities. Better health and attitudes are the result of increased moderate to vigorous activity, nutritious food, and coaching. Lives are changed, outlooks are brighter as each of our participants become better individuals through the mastery of snow and life skills. Our youth use these experiences to explore and pursue new academic, life and sport opportunities.

 **Organizational Mission**

  

At Winter4Kids, Welcoming, Empathy, Embracing and Belonging are our key values, and these values are part of everything we do and who we are. In our programs we focus on every young person developing better attitudes about their Self, Health, Opportunities, Mastery, and the Outdoors. In your time with Winter4Kids, you make a difference, saving and changing the lives of youth. And that’s just the beginning.

  

Working at Winter4Kids gives talented individuals the opportunity to change lives and strengthen communities. Whichever role you choose at Winter4Kids, you'll find satisfaction in knowing that your contributions are helping to support young people, improve health and well-being, inspire positive action and so much more. At Winter4Kids, you'll work alongside team members with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skill sets. You'll discover new ways to forge relationships, find your purpose and fuel your passion every day.

 **Work Schedule:** Sunday/ Tuesday/Wednesday/ Thursday

title: Life And Health Insurance Agent
description:
Our rapidly-expanding insurance agency is looking for a full-time life insurance agent to join our team! You’ll grow a list of prospective clients, market our insurance products, showcase our offerings to new customers, and help policyholders navigate the claims process. We’ll provide the support network and resources to help you reach - and exceed - your sales goals. If you have a strong drive to succeed, great communication skills, and outstanding customer service skills, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!**Compensation:**
$84,000 at plan yearly + benefits

**Responsibilities:*** Maintain databases, records, and bookkeeping, ensuring all paperwork is up to date
* Address existing and prospective customer requests in a prompt and friendly matter, including booking new meetings and responding to inquiries regarding billing, eligibility, coverage, claims, and insurance policies
* Aid policyholders with the insurance claims process while supervising the progress of current insurance claims
* Expand our prospective customer base and market our insurance products via including networking, referrals, cold calling, and various marketing strategies to bring in new business
* Determine new customers’ insurance needs, desires, insurance risk, prior coverage, and financial standing via booked consultations to ensure the best client experience possible


* Meeting and contacting new potential clients to discuss financial concerns and needs
* Conducting information-gathering meetings with clients
* Analyzing client needs and presenting potential solutions
* Providing ongoing service to clients
* Developing and implementing personal business and marketing plans
* On-going development of professional skills and knowledge

**Qualifications:*** Previous health insurance or life insurance experience a plus
* Previous customer service or experience as a sales representative preferred
* Candidates must have a high school diploma or GED; a Bachelor’s degree is a plus
* Candidates with an active Life & Health insurance license are strongly preferred
* Skilled with Microsoft Office

**About Company**  

New York Life, established in 1845, is one of the most respected and successful companies in America and internationally. Headquartered in New York City, New York Life's family of companies offers life insurance, retirement income products, and long-term care insurance. New York Life Investment Management LLC provides institutional asset management and retirement plan services. Other New York Life affiliates provide an array of securities products and services, as well as institutional and retail mutual funds.

description:
```Responsibilities```:  
- Oversee and manage all aspects of office operations including filing insurance claims and taking payment on site  
- Develop and implement office policies and procedures  
- Coordinate and schedule appointments and meetings  
- Maintain office supplies and equipment inventory  
- Manage office budget, including tracking expenses and preparing reports  
- Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence  
- Assist with human resources tasks, such as onboarding new employees and managing employee records  
- Ensure the office is clean, organized, and presentable at all times

```Qualifications```:  
- Proven experience as an office manager or in a similar role  
- Strong organizational and multitasking skills  
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills  
- Proficient in budgeting and financial management  
- Knowledge of clerical procedures and office management systems  
- Familiarity with vendor management processes

-Basic ability to evaluate x-rays  
- Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion  
- Proficient in using phone systems and other office equipment  
- Strong attention to detail

Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position. It is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, qualifications, or working conditions associated with the role.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $59,864.00 - $65,046.00 per year

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Relocate:

* Hackensack, NJ 07601: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Coding and Compliance Internal Auditor II
description:
Responsible for coding quality audits of all records (outpatient, inpatient, procedures, testing) to assure appropriateness and accurate code assignments in accordance with Center of Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) guidelines and provide ongoing feedback and analysis of the education needs for the providers and staff; also responsible for assisting with coding inquiries from providers, charge posters, billing staff, etc.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

1. Creates and develops new educational materials for the department to utilize to train our practitioners


2. Collaborates with management to ensure training material is up to date and what is in demand


3. Assists in further developing and troubleshooting the Teams application to fit our departments needs


4. Runs billing data and spear heads our spot check process
  

  

5. Coordinates, schedules, performs the professional services documentation and coding audits of outpatient, inpatient, procedures and testing records for AMG
  

6. Evaluates the quality of clinical documentation to identify incomplete or inconsistent documentation that could impact the quality of data being reported
  

7. Audits codes and professional fee services performed by providers from medical records according to ICD-10, CPT, HCPCS, and CMS guidelines
  

8. Responsible for maintaining up to date knowledge of coding guidelines as they relate to professional services.
  

9. Develop and coordinate educational and training programs regarding elements of coding such as appropriate documentation, accurate coding, coding trends found during chart reviews, third party audit findings, and annual coding updates.
  

10. Evaluates and provides appropriate documentation for the third party payer CPT denials to maintain the original CPT assignment, and when necessary, implement corrective action plan and/or educational programs to prevent similar denials and rejections from recurring.
  

11. Meets with the providers to review the audit findings and to recommend ways to improve when indicated
  

12. Orients and trains new providers throughout the year
  

13. Audit charts for accurate and correct coding and compliance within documentation guidelines and AMG/AHS policies
  

14. Prepares written reports of the audit findings by provider/practice
  

15. Follows up with providers as needed until documentation improves
  

16. Assists with claim denial reports to ensure optimal reimbursement
  

17. Serves as a resource to the office staff, providers, and billing department
  

18. Provides clarification on AMG coding and compliance policies


  
Required:
  

1. CPC Certification
  

2. Minimum 3 years experience in similar role
  

3. High School Diploma, College a plus
  

4. Work Experience in healthcare which includes Medical Terminology and Coding/Billing

title: Quality Coordinator (RN)
description:
**Reports to: Manager of Education and Quality**

**Job Qualifications/Experience:**

* Graduate of an accredited nursing program. BS in nursing or related field. Masters preferred.
* Current NJ RN license.
* Experience in QAPI activities a plus

Physical Requirements as Defined by Occupational Safety  

* 
**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Promotes QAPI Agenda and Initiatives
* Monitors OBQI
* Monitors and coordinates leadership for process updates and Potentially Avoidable Events audits, monitors SHP follow up
* Monitors and reports on Home Health and Hospice Compare
* Participates in quarterly OASIS monitoring
* Oversees occurrence reporting
* Monitors websites for OASIS and payment structure updates
* Participates in policy review and development
* Assists in designing new processes
Responsible for advancing OASIS transfers and discharges weekly  
* 

* Oversees Quality Committees
* Runs Home Health QAPI Committee
* Leads Fall Prevention Program
* Spearheads PI Projects
Participates in Hospice quality initiatives  
* 

* Oversees agency audits to identify trends and to promote integrity in clinical outcomes and billing practices
* Organizes and participates in billing audits quarterly
* Oversees and participates in monthly UR chart audits
* Reports on audit findings at quarterly QAPI meeting
* Assists field staff, managers, assistant managers, intake staff and CRC’s in resolution of clinical, OASIS, Billing and Coding issues
Assists with discharge outcome reviews as per SHP reports weekly  
* 

* Oversees and monitors all agency appeal processes
* Manage Medicare and Medicaid audits and appeals
* Assists with NOMNC Appeals
Manages the weekly OASIS transmission error follow up  
* 

* Participates in all Joint Commission and DOH surveys
* Assist with PPR completion
* Assist with applications
PIP initiation and oversight  
* 

* Assures that staff meets required competencies
* Participates in orientation of new staff
* Participates in the development of CRC’s and Assistant Managers
* Evaluates education needs of staff (ie – OASIS and regulatory) and works with education staff to present them to staff
Works to ensure compliance with regulatory and licensure requirements  
* 

* Assists with growing agency business
* Cross trains to learn new skills required for role
* Accepts other assignments as requested to support agency

title: Rehabilitation Aide - Full Time, Inpatient HMC and NMC
description:
Atlantic Health System is seeking a dynamic individual with an interest in Physical Therapy for a role as a Rehabilitation Aide in their inpatient Rehabilitation Department at Newton Hospital. The ideal candidate will be responsible for assisting the rehabilitation therapist and their assistant in the therapeutic treatment of acutely ill patients and providing assistance with physical exercise, bathing, and other activities. The candidate will ensure and assist patients to and from their room to the therapy center.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Assists the therapist in carrying out each patient's interdisciplinary plan of care for therapy.
  

2. Maintains equipment and advises the therapist of any issues that arises.
  

3. Prepares and manages supplies and equipment's and maintains rooms for therapy sessions.
  

4. Ensures and manages the phone calls, schedule appointments, and respond to patient queries.
  

5. Maintains and organizes the inventory supplies, ordering stock, and cleaning the stock areas.
  

6. Ensures and maintains equipment and treatment room clean before and after therapy session.
  

7. Performs and assists day-to-day non-clinical patient care duties.
  

8. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. High School Diploma or equivalent.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Prior experience working with patients preferred.

title: Registered Nurse, Per Diem Days, Deskovick 4
description:
Responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses or disabilities. Monitors patients, administers medications, keeps records, consults with healthcare providers, educates patients and more.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Maintains accurate, complete health care records and reports.
  

2. Administers medications to patients and monitors them for side effects and reactions.
  

3. Prescribes assistive medical devices and related treatments.
  

4. Monitors, reports, and records symptoms or changes in patient conditions.
  

5. Assesses, implements, plans, or evaluates patient nursing care plans by working with healthcare team members.
  

6. Records patient vital signs and medical information.
  

7. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Graduate of an accredited Nursing Program.
  

2. Current state licensure as a Registered Nurse.
  

3. BLS certification.


Preferred:
  

1. Bachelor’s degree in nursing.
  

a. All ASN must complete their BSN studies within five years of their start date.
  

2. Master’s degree in nursing or related field.
  

3. 1+ year of experience in Nursing or relevant area.
  

4. ACLS certification.

title: Registered Vascular Sonographer, Per Diem, OMC
description:
Job Description:


Overlook Medical Center is seeking a Registered Vascular Sonographer to perform diagnostic quality vascular studies. The candidate should possess sonographic skills in testing upper and lower extremity venous, extracranial carotid arteries, physiologic testing (PVR), bypass grafts, dialysis, and abdominal scanning.


This is a per diem position covering OMC and offsite vascular lab at the Union campus.


Essential Function/Responsibilities:


* Performance of vascular scans in accordance with established department protocols based on IAC vascular standards and in compliance with Atlantic Health System (AHS) policies and procedures.
* Complete clerical tasks associated with vascular exams, including completing and recording all testing information accurately and in a timely manner.
* Knowledge of DICOM workflow inclusive of work list, imaging, exporting, and preliminary reporting.
* Perform various vascular tests including venous and arterial duplex, PVR/ABI, carotid, temporal artery, AAA duplex, renal duplex, SMA duplex and portal duplex with elastography.
* Experience in Epic and Change Health software preferred.

  
Minimum Education:


* High School Graduate or equivalent
* Graduate of an accredited CVT school with focus on vascular sonography (CAAHEP accredited preferred).

Skills and Qualification:


* Credentialed with American Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS) or Cardiovascular Credentialing International (CCI).
* Registered Vascular Technologist (RVT) or Registered Vascular Specialist (RVS) certification required.
* Candidates with a minimum of one-years’ experience in the field are preferred however new graduates that possess a strong background will be considered.
* Excellent customer service skills with patient focus required.

Named one of America's 50 Best Hospitals by Healthgrades, a World’s Best Hospital by Newsweek and recognized as a Best Regional Hospital in the NY Metro area by U.S. News & World Report.
  

  

Our Atlantic Neuroscience Institute is the region’s leader in neuroscience care. A hub for the New Jersey Stroke Network, we offer a broad range of advanced neurological, neurosurgical and neurodiagnostic services. We are also certified as a Level IV Epilepsy Center and home to the Gerald J. Glasser Brain Tumor Center, where more brain tumor surgeries are performed than anywhere else in New Jersey. Our CyberKnife® program is the largest and most experienced in the state. We also have a satellite emergency department in Union, NJ, which treats about 40,000 emergency cases each year.
  

  

Committed to providing exceptional care, Overlook Medical Center has achieved the prestigious Magnet® recognition. This designation from the American Nurses Credentialing Center is the highest national honor for nursing excellence. What’s more, Overlook Medical Center has advanced certification from The Joint Commission for perinatal care and is designated an Advanced Comprehensive Stroke Center. Additional Joint Commission-certified services include behavioral health care, spine surgery, wound care, and primary care medical home (PCMH).

title: Registered Echo Sonographer Per Diem, OMC
description:
Overlook Medical Center is seeking a Registered Cardiac Sonographer to perform diagnostic quality echo cardiography procedures. Candidate will perform echo doppler studies, stress echocardiograms and transesophageal echocardiograms.


Essential Function/Responsibilities:


* Performance of echocardiograms in accordance with established department protocols based on ASE and IAC standards and in compliance with Atlantic Health System (AHS) policies and procedures.
* Complete clerical tasks associated with echo exams, including completing and recording all testing information accurately and in a timely manner.
* Knowledge of DICOM workflow inclusive of work list, imaging, exporting, and preliminary reporting.
* The sonographer will assist the physician with performance of Transesophageal Echocardiograms (TEE) and Stress echocardiograms as needed.

  
Minimum Education:


* High School Graduate or equivalent
* Graduate of an accredited CVT school with focus on echocardiography (CAAHEP accredited preferred).

Skills and Qualification:


* Credentialed with American Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS) or Cardiovascular Credentialing International (CCI).
* Registered Diagnostic Cardiac Sonographer (RDCS) or Registered Cardiac Sonographer (RCS) certification required.
* Min. of 1 year experience performing echocardiograms in a hospital setting preferred.
* Experience in performing Transesophageal Echocardiograms preferred.
* 3D echocardiography experience is a plus.
* Excellent customer service skills with patient focus required.

title: Security Officer I- Per Diem
description:
**SECURITY PER-DIEM JOB DESCRIPTION**

Atlantic Health System is seeking a Per-Diem Security Officer for the Security Department at Newton Medical Center – Days and Shift Hours may vary.


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTION/RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* The selected candidate must be able to work, first, second and third shifts, weekends and Holidays and over time as required.
* Must be able to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. as well as stand for a minimum of 4 hours at a time.
* The candidate must be able to attend mandatory training sessions.
* Proficiency with computers is required.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to work with the departments computer system is essential.
* The selected candidate must be able to relate and engage with patients, visitors, and staff.
* The essential functions of this position include: safety tours of the facility and grounds, responding to emergencies, conducting investigations and gathering information, completing electronic reports, de-escalating violent or threatening persons.
* The candidate will be exposed to Bio-Hazards such as Blood, Vomit, Saliva, and Urine.
* The candidate will be required to pass an N95 Fit Test. Be able to wear an N95 or surgical mask for short and long periods of time.
* Candidates are will be oriented on one or more shifts during their initial orientation.
* Candidates will be required to pass an AHS approved hands on patient control tactics course.

  
**MINIMUM EDUCATION:**

High School Graduate


**MINIMUM EXPERIENCE:**

* Prior Law enforcement, Fire Service or EMS experience highly preferred.
* Former Military, Reserve Military and Law Enforcement candidates preferred.
* Thorough background checks conducted.
* Reading, writing, communication and computer skills.

**LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS:**

* **Valid Driver’s License required.**
* High School Diploma required.
* Associates or Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
* High School Diploma plus Military, Law Enforcement, Fire Service, Emergency Medical Service or Security experience, will be considered in lieu of associate's degree.
* S.O.R.A. preferred.

  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ
* Overlook Medical Center, Summit, NJ
* Newton Medical Center, Newton, NJ
* Chilton Medical Center, Pompton Plains, NJ
* Hackettstown Medical Center, Hackettstown, NJ
* Goryeb Children's Hospital, Morristown, NJ
* CentraState Healthcare System, Freehold, NJ
* Atlantic Home Care and Hospice
* Atlantic Mobile Health
* Atlantic Rehabilitation

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.


We have received awards and recognition for the services we have provided to our patients, team members and communities. Below are just a few of our accolades:


* 100 Best Companies to Work For ® and FORTUNE® magazine for 15 years
* Best Places to Work in Healthcare - Modern Healthcare
* 150 Top Places to work in Healthcare - Becker's Healthcare
* 100 Accountable Care Organizations to Know - Becker's Hospital Review
* Best Employers for Workers over 50 - AARP
* Gold-Level "Well Workplace": Wellness Council of America (WELCOA)
* One of the 100 Best Workplaces for “Millennials” Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* One of the 20 Best Workplaces in Health Care: Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* Official Health Care Partner of the New York Jets
* NJ Sustainable Business
Since 1932, Newton Medical Center has been providing care to the people of Sussex and warren counties in New Jersey, Pike County in Pennsylvania and southern Orange County in New York. We are home to the Center for Breast Health, the only one of its kind in Sussex County, addressing all of a woman’s breast health needs with state-of-the-art technology, resources, education, support and follow-up care. Newton Medical Center recently achieved the American Nurses Credentialing Center’s Pathway to Excellence designation and is one of a select few health care facilities in New Jersey accredited by the Intersocietal Accreditation Commission (IAC) in all three echocardiography procedures: adult transthoracic, adult transesophogeal and adult stress.

title: VP/Derivatives Trader - Fixed Income & Equity
description:
Who You'll Work With:
AB’s Fixed Income group is looking for a trader to execute on behalf of an Insurance ALM hedging book. The focus of the role is on execution, investment advice, client service, and relationship management. This is a dynamic role covering multiple asset classes including listed and OTC Fixed Income & Equity derivatives. The trader will serve the client on a dedicated basis while sitting alongside the rest of the fixed income trading desk. The person will partner with the client to provide strategic guidance and thought leadership on hedging strategies and liquidity management. The trader is expected to add value and have high impact on the business, driving improved performance in investment management, execution, and enabling scale as the client’s book of business grows.
What You'll Do:* Execution of all VA trades for dedicated client portfolio
* Collaborate with PMs to reduce trading costs
* Work collaboratively with internal and external parties to deliver investment advice, dynamic trading intelligence, and integrated investment process
* Enhance proprietary cutting edge OEMS trading technology
* Partner with internal and external parties to optimize collateral management on derivatives transactions
* Partner with client group and derivative operations teams to deliver superior client outcomes and experience
* Partner with the client to prepare for shifts in regulatory or market structure regimes


What We're Looking For:* 7+ years professional experience
* Strong academic credentials, with a Bachelor’s degree
* Deep market structure knowledge in Equities or Fixed Income derivative hedging strategies
* Experience with ALM hedge accounting and strategies
* Relationships and experience interacting with sell side trading desks
* Strong interpersonal skills and experience in a collaborative, team-based, results oriented environment
* Outstanding problem-solving abilities and communication skills
* Ability to adapt to shifting priorities
* Strong ownership mindset
* A self-starter with an attitude and practice of proactive idea generation and continuous review and improvement to our processes


Who We Are:
We are a leading global investment management firm offering high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, retail investors, and private-wealth clients in major markets around the globe. With over 4,000 employees across 57 locations operating in 26 countries and jurisdictions, our ambition is simple: to be the most trusted investment firm in the world. We
realize that it's our people who give us a competitive advantage and drive success in the market, and our goal is to create an inclusive culture that rewards hard work.
Our culture of intellectual curiosity and collaboration creates an environment where you can thrive and do your best work. Whether you're producing thought-provoking research, identifying compelling investment opportunities, infusing new technologies into our business or providing thoughtful advice to our clients, we are fully invested in you. If you're ready to challenge your limits and empower your career, join us!*In accordance with applicable law, the minimum and maximum base annual salary for this role is as follows:**Base Salary Range: $150,000 to $200,000**Actual base salaries may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base salary is just one component of total compensation at AB, which may include, depending on eligibility, commissions, year-end incentive compensation, short- and long-term incentives and Department-specific awards. In addition AB provides a variety of benefits to eligible employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays, sick and vacation time off**AB does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status or any other basis that is prohibited by applicable law. AB’s policies, as well as practices, seek to ensure that employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants, based solely on job-related criteria*

title: Technical Project Manager / Scrum Master - IICS
description:
We **have long term contract role** for **Technical Project Manager / Scrum Master** **-\\*** IICS **for** Princeton, NJ\\*.

**Technical Project Manager / Scrum Master -** **IICS**

**Location: Hybrid (Princeton, NJ) – 2-3 days in office**

**Job Description**

We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Project Manager / Scrum Master with deep hands-on experience in Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS), specifically in Cloud Application Integration (CAI) and Cloud Data Integration (CDI). The ideal candidate will be responsible for leading and managing the end-to-end delivery of IICS projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives, and driving successful project outcomes. Key Responsibilities:

* Project Management: Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of IICS projects, ensuring that project goals, timelines, and budgets are met.
* Scrum Leadership: Facilitate daily stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint reviews, and retrospectives. Ensure that the Scrum framework is effectively implemented, and continuously improve team practices.
* Technical Expertise: Provide hands-on expertise in IICS, particularly in CAI and CDI, guiding the team in best practices and troubleshooting technical issues.
* Stakeholder Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact between the technical team and stakeholders. Communicate project progress, risks, and issues in a clear and timely manner.
* Risk Management: Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies. Ensure that risks are communicated to stakeholders and addressed proactively.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, analysts, and QA, to ensure that project deliverables are aligned with business requirements. **Documentation: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, technical specifications, and change logs.**
* Quality Assurance: Ensure that all deliverables meet the highest standards of quality and align with the organization’s objectives. Qualifications:
* Experience: 5+ years of experience in project management and Scrum, with a strong focus on IICS (CAI and CDI).
* Technical Skills: Deep hands-on experience with Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services, specifically in Cloud Application Integration (CAI) and Cloud Data Integration (CDI).
* Certifications: PMP, CSM, or equivalent certifications are highly preferred.
* Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non [1]technical stakeholders.
* Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing challenges.
* Leadership: Proven ability to lead and motivate teams, fostering a collaborative and productive work environment.
* Agile Methodology: In-depth knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies, with a track record of successful implementation in previous projects.
* Nice to have experience in managing application and data integration projects within the Life Sciences domain.

* PMP (Preferred)

title: Bilingual Spanish language Instructor at after school program. Grades pre-k (UES)
description:
Parker Anderson Enrichment NYC is looking to hire **very part time after-school enrichment instructors to teach one hour after school on a set schedule**. Pay minimum is $75 per class. It's about a 1 hour 20 minute commitment with 1 hour of active teaching), paid as an independent contactor through zelle pay once per month. Most of our teachers teach 1-3 classes per week 1 hour per day (depending on schedule/availability).  
Classes are immediately after school and on site at schools starting in September or October. **Most classes run from 3-4 pm and you would need to arrive by 2:30 pm or so on site. Occassionally schools book classes at 3:30 pm.** Please only apply if you have this time period available at least once or twice per week and factor in any commutes you may have.

**Details for Spanish Immersion**

Designed for young students, Spanish Immersion teaches conversational and basic Spanish language using Total Physical Response (TPR)- a "learn by doing" approach. Every activity has students speaking, listening, acting and learning, and is enriched by studies of Spanish and Latin American cultures!

This class comes with curriculum.

Our classes run anywhere from 8 weeks to 18 weeks, again depending on the school. We share all school information and ask that you make sure all times, dates, subjects work for you before committing. We provide curriculum for our classes, but would prefer instructors who can enhance and adapt our curriculum. Pay is $50 per class (up to an hour of active teaching, though you are expected to arrive at least 20 minutes before start time.) We pay higher for specialized classes like piano, guitar, dance, and ASL (where instructors would need to provide their own curriculum) and very experienced teachers. 90 minute classes also pay a $75 minimum.

**Dates for the class:** 9/26/24 - 12/12/24

**Times:** 2:45pm- 3:25pm

**Grades:** prek-k

**Neighborhood:** Upper East Side (E. 70's)

Requirements:  
-**Must have NYCDOE (New York City Department of Education) fingerprint clearance OR willingness to obtain (it's easy and we can nominate you. It is a prerequisite of employment- it does not expire)**   
-**afternoon availability to be on site at a Upper West Side, Upper East Side, midtown, lower Manhattan or Brooklyn (depending on school schedule and your location preferences ) around 2:30 pm. Most classes run from 3 until 4 pm with around an hour of active teaching time or around that time frame. Please let us know if you are also open to Hoboken, NJ.**  
**- be fully vaccinated and boosted (vaccination is an NYC school requirement, though some of our schools require boosters too)**  
- **experience working with elementary aged group of students**  
This job is perfect for part time teachers, substitutes, retired educators, students, part time employees, etc. - basically anyone who has other things going on in their life where the time commitment availability for mid-afternoon teaching will not be a problem/conflict and who has other things going on in their life and could use extra cash.  
Please send a resume, a little blurb about yourself and note your availability for a short preliminary phone/zoom interview. We will respond to all qualified, local candidates.

Here is a sample of classes we teach: https://www.paenynj.org/classdescriptions

As of right now we are actively hiring for: Cartoon animation and comics creation, piano, guitar, chess, programmable robots, yoga, LEGO, Sportsworld, ninja academy and dinoworld.

If there is anything you would like us to consider you for you can submit a short recorded video of about 5 min or so showcasing your teaching style/skills for a young elementary aged group class, we’d appreciate it and can follow up with a very short phone or zoom call interview. We can also send you one or two of our typical lessons, if you prefer to showcase something from our curriculum. If you would like to create/share a short instructional video please do so.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school

Experience:

* Teaching: 1 year (Required)
* Experience with children: 1 year (Required)
* Classroom management: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Territory Manager - Stamford, CT
description:
**Primary Role / Job Purpose**


The Territory Manager’s primary role is to represent the Optinose novel product, XHANCE™ (fluticasone propionate) nasal spray, approved for the treatment of nasal polyps and chronic sinusitis in adults. Understand and identify a customer’s needs, support pull-through activities relative to the customer strategy and market access, deliver sales results and ensure Optinose is viewed as a valued partner to healthcare professionals and their patients. Develop superior product and disease state knowledge in order to engage in a clinical dialogue with healthcare professionals and effectively educate on approved indications and product efficacy/safety profiles to support on-label prescribing for appropriate patients.


This territory includes the Connecticut areas of New Haven, Waterbury, Fairfield, and Norwalk and the area of White Plains, NY.

**Essential Accountable Functions/Responsibilities:**

* Drive outstanding sales performance. Effectively use assigned budgets and resources to drive therapeutic and territory expectations. Customize discussions and client interactions based on customer’s needs.
* Maintain current understanding of local market, practice structures, business models, and key influencers. Work with appropriate customers to understand practice structure, business model, key influencers, network structure, customer needs and identify business opportunities.
* Provide input into resource allocation decisions across customers/district. Identify and select programs/resources available and appropriate for each customer, practice, and/or system.
* Work with Optinose Regional Business Director and other Commercial Leaders to develop a local business plan that ensures achievement of all KPI goals and delivery on all sales objectives.
* Work with other Territory Managers around common objectives to coordinate selling efforts.

**Qualifications/Experience:**

* A Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university
* 5+ years’ pharmaceutical sales experience
* Specialty sales for 2+ years
* A thorough understanding of the differences in calling on PCP offices vs Specialists
* A proven record of accomplishment
* Drug delivery/respiratory experience
* Emerging company experience preferred
* Marketing or other cross-functional experience preferred
* Product Launch experience preferred
* Ability to travel and possess a valid driver’s license to drive to assigned healthcare accounts, unless otherwise specified

  

Optinose anticipates that his position will have a base salary in the range of $100,000 - $125,000. Actual compensation is influenced by a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, level of experience, skill set, and territory location. This position will be eligible to participate in the Optinose Fleet Program and benefits include medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) Plan, paid vacation and sick days, as well as stock options and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status. OptiNose US, Inc. takes affirmative action in support of its policy to employ and advance employment individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.


Optinose US, Inc. is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

**Search Firm Representatives – Please Read Carefully**


To protect the interests of all parties, OptiNose Us, Inc. will not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs and/or resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no valid fully executed search agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, resumes will only be accepted if a specific job order has been placed. Please refrain from phone calls or emails.

description:
The Client

Private Equity Firm

The Need

GSM Virtual Assistants is seeking to add a highly motivated Executive Administrative Assistant to support the Managing Director of a Private Equity firm. This will be a hire directly with the firm. Previous experience in supporting senior executives and managing complex calendars is mandatory.

Must be located in New York City area.

**In person - 3 days in Midtown Manhattan required / 2 days remote**

**What You'll Do:**

* Coordinate complex, senior-level internal/external meetings and conference calls
* Maintain an extremely detailed calendar and related logistics
* Interact with senior level investors in a professional and effective manner
* Respond and follow up on client requests
* Coordinate a high volume of domestic and international travel
* Process expense reports
* Perform other tasks, including but not limited to, preparing correspondence and other communications, file organization, research, archiving
* Maintain understanding of firm policies

**Who They're Looking For:**

* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* High attention to detail and strong organizational skills
* Ability to solve problems quickly and efficiently
* Knowledge of general business, corporate and government cultures
* Ability to handle highly sensitive, confidential and non-routine information
* Comfortable working with people at all organizational levels
* Ability to work well under pressure, adapt to unexpected events, and prioritize and multi- task in a deadline driven environment
* Must have excellent judgment; be an independent thinker and resourceful
* Team player with a positive attitude (no task too small)
* Highest degree of integrity, professionalism, diplomacy and discretion required
* Strong proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
* 5+ years' experience supporting C-suites
* Education: Bachelor's Degree preferred

Compensation - ($135,000 annual + 20-25% bonus)

Pay: $135,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10037

title: Warehouse Associate (10:00 AM - 6:30 PM)
description:
**Company Description**  

For over 30 years, KSI Auto Parts has been supplying premium aftermarket collision parts and providing the highest quality customer service. We believe what makes us stand out and rise above the competition is our dedication to our customer' and employee's satisfaction. We stand by our motto, “One Team, One Goal” and are on the search for talented individuals who want to make an impact in our organization. We value our employees and want to invest in their development and growth. If you have the same goals in mind, please apply, we'd love to have you join the team at KSI!

 **Job Description**  

As we continue to grow, we are looking for motivated and committed Warehouse Associates to join our team. As a Warehouse Associate, you will be responsible for general warehouse duties such as loading, unloading, staging, picking and packing auto parts. The Warehouse Associate will also be required to operate a Cherry Picker and be cross trained in other departments within the distribution center.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Load, unload, pick, put away, consolidate, stack, and stage products and materials using a Cherry Picker, forklift, pallet jack, or other warehousing equipment.
* Follow specific work instructions and best practices to safely and accurately complete daily work assignments.
* Assists with physical inventories, cycle counting, and light data entry.
* Assist in various warehouse maintenance tasks, including sweeping floors, storing equipment, etc.
* Operate cherry picker and forklift within safety standards.
* Pull orders based on corresponding pick tickets and labels.
* Process warehouse shipments, remove unallocated items from warehouse shipments, check in-bound shipments.
* Cross train in shipping, receiving, inventory, returns, and other departments within distribution center.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Must have a minimum of one year of warehouse or distribution experience.
* Ability to operate warehouse equipment such as cherry picker, forklift, hand truck etc.
* Basic math, reading and writing skills to perform required tasks.
* Ability to push, pull, reach, bend, and lift up to 75LBS.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Must be willing to stand for long periods of time.

  

**Additional Information** **Shift & Hours:**


Monday – Saturday 12:00 PM - 8:30 PM

**Compensation:** $18- $19 / hour, based on experience

**Benefits:**


KSI Auto Parts offers a comprehensive benefits package to eligible employees. This includes 10 days of paid time off (PTO), health, dental, and vision insurance, 6 paid holidays, a generous matching 401K plan, and supplemental insurance. Employees also have access to discounts through healthcare and payroll providers.

 *#LI-DNI*

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift, pull and move up to 50-75 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

***EEO*** *KSI Auto Parts provides equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.*

***E-VERIFY*** *KSI Auto Parts and its subsidiaries use E-verify, a government-run, web-based system that allows employers to confirm the eligibility of their employees to work in the United States. For more information, please go to https://www.e-verify.gov/employees or view the poster at* *https://e-verify.uscis.gov/web/media/resourcesContents/E-Verify\\_Participation\\_Poster.pdf**.*


You can read more about us on our Company Page or follow us on Facebook, Instagram, & LinkedIn.

title: Early Childhood Teacher Assistant 2024-2025 School Year
description:
Early Childhood Assistant Teacher Position available  
Greenburgh Hebrew Center Early Childhood Center

About Greenburgh Hebrew Center  
Greenburgh Hebrew Center (www.ghcny.org) is a warm, inclusive, egalitarian, participatory Jewish congregation located in Dobbs Ferry, NY.

About the Greenburgh Hebrew Center Early Childhood Center  
(GHC ECC) is a private, not-for-profit preschool that offers a combined secular and Judaic curriculum in a nurturing, emotionally supportive and creative atmosphere. The school is located in dedicated classroom and play space at Greenburgh Hebrew Center.

Overview of Responsibilities:

Assistant Teacher –yearly salary position  
Be present for school hours (9:00 a.m. – 11:45 a.m., Monday - Friday. Arrive at least 15 minutes early to greet parents/caregivers and children.  
Respond to the supervision and direction of the Head Teacher of the class to which he/she is assigned, and have such responsibilities and duties as prescribed by the Director or Head Teacher.  
Treat all children with dignity and respect.  
Provide care, guidance, and meet the needs of the children (social, emotional, physical and intellectual).  
Assist the Head Teacher in preparation and functioning of the school program, which may include:  
Assisting in the supervision of a group during indoor and outdoor activities  
Preparation of foods for snacks and cooking projects. Observe and reinforce kashrut dietary laws.  
Supervising the class if the Head Teacher is out of the room or absent.  
Assisting in preparing the learning environment, setting up interest centers and preparing materials and supplies for projects.  
Assist in clean-up and general housekeeping tasks (toileting/ diaper changes).  
Attending staff meetings and early childhood workshops, and pursue professional development opportunities.  
Attending staff meetings, parent orientation and staff development.  
Actively pursue professional excellence by participating in conferences, courses and other opportunities for professional growth.  
Assist during dismissal.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* As we are a Jewish school, knowledge of Judaism is important. Do you have a working knowledge of Judaism?

Education:

* Associate (Preferred)

Experience:

* Early Childhood Education: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Residential Sales Specialist
description:
**Benefits Start Day 1 for Full-Time Colleagues - No Waiting Period!**

*For more information about our benefits, see below!*


We are proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control and other services across more than 90 countries. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands and serve consumer and business customers across multiple industries. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to fulfill our mission to "protect people, enhance lives, and preserve the planet."

**What do our Residential Sales Specialists do?**


The primary purpose of this role is selling the company's Residential Pest Management Services and Products to new and existing residential customers, while maintaining a customer-focused service to grow the business. This includes assessing customers' needs by performing a needs analysis based on customer concerns using expert knowledge of the company's products and services that result in the sales of the organization's pest control solutions.

**Functions include, but are not limited to the following:**

* Assessing customers' needs by performing a needs analysis based on customer concerns using expert knowledge of the company's products and services and certifications.
* Visually inspects homes and businesses for pests, pest harborage, pest entries, etc
* Based on assessment findings, sell pest control solutions for residential customers.
* Collaborates with our customer service center, Inside Sales department, and technicians for increased opportunities
* Partners with Branch Manager to identify revenue streams with our current base and service specialist engagement Develop proposals for customers to resolve existing pest issues while also proposing additional enhancements to pest household services.
* Complete Home diagram using Sales CRM and provided to ensure clear understanding of customer home and possible challenges.
* Follow up on past proposals to close sales opportunities
* Provide expert knowledge to new service installations to ensure the job is completed satisfactorily
* Complete daily activities and sales performance using the company sales CRM

**What do you need?**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Prefer Associate's or Technical degree
* Pest Industry certifications a plus
* Must have 1 or more years of sales or pest technician experience
* Prefer 1-2 years of experience in pest control sales and 2 or more years in a customer service role
* Must be an effective verbal communicator, with particular emphasis on customer-facing conversations and presentation with additional follow-ups
* Travel up to 100% of time within assigned territory(s)


Base Pay Range: $31,200-$43,700/year  

Annual Earning Potential: $51300 - $88900 / year  

  

In addition to the base pay, a Colleague working in this role who has completed training may be eligible to earn additional monetary compensation including overtime, incentive and/or commission pay. Total annual earning potential may vary based on performance, assigned routes and achieving Key Performance Indicators ("KPIs").

**Why Choose Us?**  

  

A career with the Rentokil family of companies can be a professional trajectory filled with opportunity. We pride ourselves on being a world-class team that rewards high performance, and we love to promote from within. We offer competitive pay and many of our roles offer performance incentives.  

  

Below you'll find information about some of what we have to offer. All Full-Time Colleagues qualify for the following and Part-Time Colleagues qualify for most benefits after they meet certain criteria.  

  

Click here to read more about our Total Rewards Program which includes:  

  

**Professional and Personal Growth**

* Multiple avenues to grow your career
* Training and development programs available
* Tuition Reimbursement benefits (for FT Colleagues)

 **Health and Wellness**

* Full-time colleagues are eligible to begin enrollment immediately upon hire with benefits starting on day 1
* Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life Insurance plus much more

 **Savings and Retirement**

* 401(k) retirement plan with company-matching contributions

**Work-Life Balance**

* Vacation days & sick days
* Company-paid holidays & floating holidays
* A company mindset that prioritizes health, safety, and flexibility

  

We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work. Is that you?

  

This company is a Drug Free workplace.


Rentokil is committed to complying with all Federal, State, and local laws related to the employment of qualified individuals with disabilities.


Know Your Rights - Workplace Discrimination is Illegal


Pay Transparency - Nondiscrimination Provision


California residents click here to review your privacy rights.


By applying to this position, you consent to receive an initial text message to collect your communication preferences. Message and data rates may apply. You can opt-out any time.
